reviews.text: Great customer service while out is a HUGE deal to me. Especially while I&#39;m out with my two toddlers. <br><br>Our server was Jared, I believe is his name? He was awesome. Our drinks were NEVER empty. We never went without extra napkins or plates. He even made sure to keep bread on the table, probably thinking about my kids and understanding they don&#39;t wait very well while hungry. <br><br>He has a great attitude and never complained when I was asking for extras or changing my mind about something. <br><br>There was a nice lady that also came by a few times to bring our food or help keep our drinks filled. I cannot remember her name, but she too was awesome! I absolutely love how friendly and happy they were, even though that place was PACKED and I know they were busy trying to keep everyone happy. <br><br>I 100% recommend this location just based off the workers. I truly appreciate good people and they did so well with my kids as well. Which is extra gold stars in my book! If we ever visit KC again, we would definitely return.

Cheesecakeepic fail on Cheesecake management and staff.  Being senceible and helping the people outside  No  wait in line for 35 minutes on an order that was placed at 4 hours in advance and paid for you must go inside REALLY   better planning would have helped everyone. No such thing<br>#SkipTheLine

My husband and I were terribly disappointed with dinner.  The service was good, but the food wasn&#39;t.  My husband and I have come to the conclusion that ever since restaurants started opening back up since the mandated closure due to the coronavirus, things just haven&#39;t been the same.  We eat out a lot and we can name 9 out of 10 restaurants that have gone downhill since reopening and this is one.<br>Our taste buds were set on crab cakes.  We arrived and they were totally out of crab anything.  So we ordered other items we like...cheeseburger egg rolls came out hot but the flavor wasn&#39;t good, they made my husband feel kind of sick to his stomach .  The French fries arrived limp and barely warm .  The fried mac n cheese balls came out hot and tasty .  The sweet corn tamale cakes were warm, flimsy and tasty  and the fried Korean cauliflower was soggy and barely warm .  The only item we ate all of was the mac n cheese balls, everything else we left half or more.  <br>The restaurant wasn&#39;t packed so we couldn&#39;t figure out why the bad food.  Most of our food seemed like it sat in the window a long time before it was brought to us.<br>I took pictures, but they aren&#39;t the best because the lighting was real dim and their lights are yellow and orange.  I tried.<br>I can say that if you didn&#39;t have a face mask on, you were turned away  and the tables inside were socially distanced .<br>We think we&#39;re gonna spend more time eating at home till these restaurants can get back to the way they used to be
Best place for dinner in downtown plaza . Love the Thai wraps vegetable . Delicious dinner plus the cheese cake cookies and cream yummm . Best desert ever .

It is at country club plaza.The view from the second floor is pretty good.We went there last Sunday and waited for 20 minutes to get our food.It was so busy for lunch.We ordered two dishes, one is Thai coconut chicken with green curry sauce, the other is impossible hamburger.To be honest,the chicken dish is awesome, as same as I ate at the Thai restaurants.But the hamburger is just so so.We ordered the pineapple cheesecake, and it is yummy!The average cost of main dish is around $15, a little pricey.The atmosphere is good for dating or special events.

It has always been a great dining experience here. The cheesecakes are wonderful. They serve one of my favourite salads and everything on the menu is fresh. On my last visit, my veggie friend&#39;s order was customized really well and I absolutely loved my peach smoothie. <br>I&#39;ll be back soon!
I enjoyed some great items for brunch (I forgot to include a picture of my mimosa). Every thing was wonderful. I&#39;m looking forward to going back soon.

I was there early because I had my table reserved and they said I could not be seated until half of my guest were there. I had to wait outside in the rain and then they told me that if my guest weren&#39;t there I&#39;m ten minutes they were going to give my table away. I reserved the table for a surprise for someone and couldn&#39;t even get in the building that I had a table reserved for.
Stopped by for happy hour... Monday not busy.... only 5:30....only giving 2 tables for HH

EDIT: <br>I would like to edit my review because although it wasn&#39;t a pleasant experience to start, recognition is deserved when these subpar experiences are made right. Thank you to Catie (different manager) for reaching out and also listening. She handled things professionally and I look forward to my next visit at the Cheesecake Factory.

As a table of 6, we were given an hour and twenty wait estimate. As if that&#39;s not enough, they don&#39;t have adequate seating while you&#39;re waiting, so we&#39;ve been standing that entire time. Everyone that we were behind were seated a long time ago, and many, many people who have come after us have also been seated, including groups of 7.<br><br>After an hour and twenty, they told us that they assign you a table (instead of first come, first serve) and that the people at our assigned table had paid and were just sitting, drinking coffee, and talking. <br><br>After an hour and 45 and at least 3 people in our party checking with them and being told 10 to 15 minutes twice, the hostess finally decided that the people at our assigned table weren&#39;t leaving any time soon and THEN decided to give us whatever table was next available.<br><br>A few minutes later, they tell us a table opened up and sent us upstairs. We were escorted to the table only to find it only seated 4 and then were told that a table was available downstairs. Nearly 2 hours later, we&#39;ve finally been seated...as people who came BEHIND us have already eaten and are getting up to leave.<br><br>This all could have been solved with reservations, which they don&#39;t do.<br><br>Our server was really great in terms of making sure our drinks were filled, and we tipped well for that reason. It&#39;s not his fault that the rest of the restaurant doesn&#39;t seem to be ran well.<br><br>My dad always takes leftovers and didn&#39;t even take his bang bang chicken. He&#39;s not one to complain, and he said it was nasty. I tried it, and it was very sweet yet bland. (Update: he and I both got sick later, and we have iron stomachs...so something was off.)<br><br>I got shepherd&#39;s pie. It was good, but not worth the wait or ever going back honestly. And I had heard such good things about cheesecake factory... Maybe other locations are better, but it&#39;s not worth the risk at your expense.<br><br>The other 4 said their meal was good, but in all of the chaos, my mom&#39;s order got mixed up with a similar title. She mentioned it to the server, but I don&#39;t think he understood. She&#39;s also not one to complain, so at that point, didn&#39;t say anything else. <br><br>3 hours... $150. Mediocre food. Not really worth it. Maybe try one of the others in the area.

Chain restraint with a massive menu. I don&#39;t remember seeing many healthy options. The cheese cake menu was huge, as the name might imply. It feels like a chain restaurant posing as a fine restaurant. Ultimately I&#39;d only pick this spot again if I was looking for the biggest portions possible.

I very seldom go to the Cheesecake Factory and my recent visit on a Friday night reminded me why.  There&#39;s always a wait for a table and, of course, Friday and Saturday nights are the worst.  The hostess told us that it would be 30 minutes for a table.  After waiting about 45 minutes, we inquired and were told that it would be another 30 minutes. So, after 45 minutes - we were still 30 minutes out.<br><br>Once seated, however, service was pretty prompt and our server was very polite and professional.  I was disappointed when he announced that they were out of Ahi tuna (at 8:00 on a Friday evening) and therefore couldn&#39;t serve the Ahi tuna tartar or any of the salads with Ahi tuna in them.  We all found something to order and the food came out pretty quick.  The food was hot and tasty; I have no issues with the food quality or service.<br><br>I&#39;d rate the service (once seated) as 4-star; the food was either a high 3-star or low 4-star but I can&#39;t give an overall rating higher than a 3-star for the hostess being 45 minutes off on her estimate of 30-minutes for a table.  By the time you&#39;ve invested 340-45 minutes waiting in line, you&#39;re not apt to leave and go somewhere else.

Cheesecake is expensive to say the least. The food is traditionally good even though the prices are higher than most farm to table restaurants in the area. After ordering for the third time a to go order through DoorDash during Covid and spending over $100, it was still wrong. For some reason, their table bread is left out of the to go orders. I called to ensure we would get their delicious wheat bread. After receiving the order to find two slices (not two mini half loaves but two slices) I called to speak to the manager. Millennial Kate was the manager on duty who continued to talk over me and say we where given the right amount of bread for what we ordered, not even speaking to the fact that it has been left out the previous two orders. It&#39;s gratuity bread! She proved her point- I won&#39;t be spending my hard earned money on a corporate restaurant anymore. I&#39;ll support my local food fares who care about my business.
One of my favorite Cheesecake Factory restaurants.. Very nice location and food is awesome

Typical Cheesecake Factory food. We had apps and drinks - nachos, chips w/spinach artichoke dip and egg rolls. Consistent with other locations. Seating was slow though the restaurant was half full. Waiter was not good. Slow, mumbled a lot and didn&#39;t check on us until food almost gone. He Forget to bring bread until apps dropped 20 minutes after ordering. The building is unique and the Outside seating is nice by the fountain.  Restrooms are upstairs and that seemed strange.
Made reservation apparently system happens to be down when we get there on time. Made us wait on anniversary. Food is usually good but service is trash

Not to be confused with the Cheesesteak Factory, which is basically Pat&#39;s and Geno&#39;s, and is even more sh**.<br><br>I don&#39;t really like the products at the Cheesecake Factory. The burgers are expensive and just okay. The milkshakes can be good but a lot of them are not good. Their special milkshakes are usually better but they don&#39;t have them year-round which is annoying. <br><br>Don&#39;t get me started on the cheesecake. I&#39;m not a huge fan of Cheesecake anyway but if I was I certainly wouldn&#39;t be getting cheesecake from this place. It just doesn&#39;t compare to truly homemade delicious cheesecake such as the ones in New York City and Chicago that I love. Eli&#39;s of Chicago, S &amp; S of The Bronx, just to name a couple.<br><br>I only ate here because one of my friends/sponsors brought me here with her family.<br><br>The lovely service is the reason for the rating.

Man, oh man I want to love this place. It probably has the best patio in The Country Club Plaza area and the location is primo...the service though, is lacking and the food quality has declined since it opened many years ago. We were able to score a lovely table outdoors last night where we sat for a little over ten minutes before a server came to greet us. She was very sweet, when we saw her, but she disappeared often, and for very long periods of time, which was difficult because we never received several things throughout the evening. A side of cilantro, a side of ranch, a basket of bread, a glass of water, two of our entrees, our check...these are all things we either never received or we had to ask for twice. The two missing entrees were so far behind the other two we ordered, our friends (who we told to go ahead and eat) were almost finished with their meals by the time they came out. My grilled shrimp tacos were cold as soon as they came to the table and fairly tasteless too unfortunately. That missing cilantro sure would have come in handy. Upon the completion of our meal I asked for the check. Seventeen minutes later, our server came by and said &#34;And you&#39;re still waiting on your check...&#34; but did not have our check in hand. I handed her my credit card and just asked her to run it. <br><br>If I can help it, I won&#39;t be back to The Cheesecake Factory on the plaza. There are far too many restaurants in this area that provide extraordinary service and outstanding food to waste my money here.

I&#39;ve been going to this location for years and have always been impressed with the customer service and food. Tonight we attempted to check in our big party for a family meal. The person who was responsible for checking us in , was rude and unprofessional to the extreme. Earlier today we called to see what the situation would be for our large party and the lady was very accommodating and said yes, it could be done with one person sitting there with the buzzer. <br><br>Armed with this information , we made it to the front desk. After giving him our party information, he made it very clear that it was just impossible. His shrugs, and noncommittal murmurs were off putting. I offered possibilities and each one was met with a shrug and shake of the head. We reached a stalemate and I said fine, just put our name in and hand me the buzzer. He said NO buzzer , but he offered a call to our cell if and when seating was possible. I will be calling Management in the morning. I also don&#39;t think they understand the amount of sales and tips  that they missed out on a table of 31. <br>Disappointed from start to finish about the situation .

Very DISAPPOINTED! Ordered a simple CHEESECAKE for my wife&#39;s birthday.  Was to pick up on curb side pick up at 5pm four days later. I was there called in and lady who answered phone had NO idea who I was.  Told her I ordered cheesecake and a choclate plaque that read Happy Birthday.  She says we are out of that. I said I was charged for it. She put me on hold, probably 15 minutes, never getting back on. Someone walked out with cake and apologized, but I was already pissed. Said he would take charges off my card. NEVER HAS A CHARGE BEEN REMOVED! I am VERY disappointed with YOUR ESTABLISHMENT!!

It&#39;s been awhile since I&#39;ve had Cheesecake and boy was I satisfied. Kansas City&#39;s location is in the mecca of downtown with many shops and restaurants.<br><br>I had the traditional strawberry cheesecake for $8.00. So good! Crab cakes bites were pretty good as my appetizer. I may come back one more time before I leave Kansas City due to the bartender&#39;s exceptional customer service.

whoever one day said yes lets roll some mac and cheese together to make balls and then fry then i just have to say they were on to something because this is the only thing i get when i come here. Yes they have the biggest menu on the Guinness record but i have to say im a creature of habit these fried mac and cheese balls just cant let you down hellllla rich but so delicious their on the appetizer part of the menu but your not gonna regret it especially since you get your pre-bread meal (go for the rye bread with butter) yum yum. 10/10 as well recommend the Adams peanut butter chocolate fudge cheeeesecakeee ahhhhhh fudge, peanut butter, chocolate crust and topped with butterfinger i actually cant tell you what more you could add to possible make it taste better the answer is nothing. i used to go for the cheesecakes that are &#34;cheesecake cakes&#34; because their 2x the size and for me the bigger the better (red velvet or the peanut butter are also a must) ive even heard the lemon flavors are phenomenal but whatever you get the foods great love dis place especially putting in 3000+ calories in one meal #worthit (stay away from the celebration cake and 50th celebration no bien) (tuxedo, smores, hershey, Oreo, rasberry chocolate, cookie dough, original are all great too!!!)
Wide variety of menu options, accommodations made for most sensitivities. Popular place any time of the week. Exceptional service.

This was my favorite restaurant. The staff is now uneducated, the food is bland and the cheesecake recipe has changed completely. For the first time in the history of me going to this place I didnt eat all my cheesecake. NOT GOOD!

It&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve been back to KC and decided to give Cheesecake Factory a go. It was on a cold Tuesday during lunch time. Not very busy at all... but the service was EXTREMELY slow. Waited for about 15 minutes until our server came by our table to take our drink order. We just ordered everything at once, since we were on a slight time schedule. Food came out fast ironically. The food was... alright. It was nothing to rave about. My boyfriend did not like his dish all but forced it down. <br>The cheesecake however, is always delicious! I usually get the original strawberry cheesecake. And the appetizer pork belly buns were great! <br>Overall.. the food is okay. My server was extremely slow.

Our wait time was an hour and 15 minutes. We reserved for a party of 10 and the hostess was extremely rude. She had blonde ombré tips and would not let us in because 5 of us were trying to find parking space. She said the whole party had to be present or we would have to wait another hour. Extremely ridiculous! She ended up splitting us up 5 and 5 and putting us farther away from each other when there was a long table that remained empty half the time we were there. Was done on purpose! Petty and unprofessional.

We made a 6:30pm reservation and we were seated on time. I ordered calamari and shrimp scampi and both were amazing! My favorite cake is pineapple upside down cake so I ordered the pineapple upside-down cheesecake and it was amazing!!!! Everything was perfect for my 50th Birthday!

We aren&#39;t crazy about the food here but we LOVE the cheesecake! If we venture down to the Plaza for dinner, we also swing by the Cheesecake Factory for some dessert. You can&#39;t go wrong with any of the cheesecakes here, but we really like the classic, vanilla bean, and dulche de leche.

Having the understanding that things are different and stressful with COVID-19, was severely disappointed with taking my wife to Cheesecake Factory for our anniversary yesterday. I had made a reservation for 4pm knowing on a Saturday things were going to be busy and we had made some plans for after eating. Received a confirmation email, and a txt asking me to confirm and did. Arrived to the restaurant at 3:45. Told hostess we had a reservation and was told it wouldn&#39;t be till 4 that we would be seated and we were fine with that knowing we arrived early. After waiting for 30 min past our reservation time we were finally seated at 4:34. <br>When we were seated the table was dirty with what looked liked strawberry syrup and crumbs and still had the previous guests check and tip sitting on the table. With a pandemic going on we assumed that they would have at least wiped the table before we got to it. Then we sat for another 14 min before our waitress even came to the table to get our drink order for the first time. After another visit because she forgot we got our drinks. After this our visit and service was ok with a couple forgotten items, but due to the long wait after our reservation time and not even ordering drinks until almost an hour reservation, we missed our plans for after dinner.

This has been one of the wwe worst nights ever at the Cheese Cake Factory. My wife and I always park at the top of the garage. We chose to park there so that we dont have a long ways to walk. I myself have a walking disability. On this night in particular we chose to visit the cheese cake factory. This was also Valentine&#39;s day. To make a long store short the elevator was not working. I had to limp with my cane one leg at time down four fights of stairs. The food we ordered the night was cold and under cooked. I spoke with a manager about the situation and of course he said there was nothing he could do, even to compensate us on our next visit. I wish I had of gotten his name, but I just letting you who never have been here before think twice about coming here. I myself will NOT EVER come back.

I went to the CF on a Friday afternoon with my boyfriend. It was about a 20 minute wait for a table around 1:30 pm. We were seated at a booth. We decided to order pot stickers as an appetizer. They were $10.99. I thought they were way overpriced. They were good, but not great by any means. They come with a ginger soy sauce. It had a lot of ginger. It was about the only thing you could taste. Then we split the grand factory burrito. It was huge! It was good! It had chicken and rice and cheese. It was pretty comparable to American Mexican burritos. Then for dessert, we split the Oreo dream cheesecake. This was amazing! It has a chocolate cake layer, chocolate cheesecake, and regular cheesecake. I highly recommend this cheesecake if you like Oreos. Overall, I&#39;ve had better trips to TCF. This one wasn&#39;t bad, but the food didn&#39;t taste sepctacu

Our waiter was amazing and the food was very good. What put a bad taste in my mouth was the hostess. I understand that we have to wear a mask when you walk in to a restaurant, we get to take it off at the table, and then put it back on when we leave. Understandable, but I got up to go use the restroom and the hostess out loud in front of everyone yelled, &#34;ma&#39;am can you please put your mask on&#34;.  Everyone stopped and stared at me like I killed someone. Her tone was not so friendly and normally I blow things off, but the way she said it really pissed me off though. There&#39;s a way to talk to people.

I came on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch with my kids, I don&#39;t know why I didn&#39;t think they&#39;d be &#34;that&#34; busy, but they were. It&#39;s okay though because the service was good. I got a steak and potatoes and green beans, and the kids got cheeseburgers. I thought my steak and green beans were a little on the salty side. <br><br>I like this location I think it&#39;s a beautiful building, but I think I&#39;ll go to the OP one, it&#39;s just less hustle and bustle

I&#39;ve never been able to put my finger on how, no matter where I go in the country, if there is a Cheesecake Factory it&#39;s going to be busy and you&#39;re going to have to wait for a table. They have definitely found the &#34;secret sauce&#34; of getting people in the door. <br><br>My visit to the Cheesecake Factory in Kansas City, MO was no different. We showed up at 6PM for dinner and sure enough there was a 40 minute wait (which I found to be pleasantly shorter than usual). Note: They do not take reservations.<br><br>I&#39;m always amazed at how extensive the menu is. Page, after page, after page of food choices. I mean, the appetizers take up 3 pages! Surprisingly, despite the sheer number of options, the kitchens across the country deliver on execution of each plate flawlessly. I can&#39;t recall ever having a bad meal at a Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Tonight we started with the Fried Cheese. Now technically, according to the menu, this was a small plate and not an appetizer but it was enough for 3 people to share. What I liked about it was, it wasn&#39;t just your typical &#34;cheese sticks.&#34; Instead, it was actually cheese, freshly breaded, and fried to a golden brown served with a nice marinara sauce. My only complaint would be serving it with cold marinara. Why do restaurants do this? Cheesecake Factory are certainly not the only ones doing it.<br><br>For entrees we had the Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken, the Bacon, Bacon Burger with Fries and a cup of New England Clam Chowder. All delicious!<br><br>And what&#39;s a trip to the Cheesecake Factory without getting some actual cheesecake, right? On this visit we ordered up the Red Velvet Cheesecake and the Reece&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Cheesecake. There were 3 of us. Even after giving it our best efforts we needed a box to take some home. Absolutely delicious, as usual, but so rich. A few bites is all we could really handle.<br><br>The last thing I will mention is the service. As with the food, I&#39;ve never had bad service at a Cheesecake Factory and my visit to the KCMO location was no different. From the host, to the seater, to my server, and anyone else who came to the table, they were all amazing. Big kudos to them!<br><br>All and all another great visit to the Cheesecake Factory.

It took me a week to write this review because I was so disappointed, but was trying to find something about this visit that I could think differently. The only thing that I could come up with that was positive about this experience was the waiter, Brian. He took care of us the best he could.<br><br>First off, the appetizers took over 30 minutes to arrive. I ordered the fried cauliflower, and will never do that again. They came out with a lot of grease at the bottom of the bowl. The breading taste as if they were coated in cornmeal. My entree was the Orange Chicken. Again, the breading taste like cornmeal and was greasy. <br><br>As I was leaving the restaurant, I saw another patron had ordered the Orange Chicken and it looked perfectly fine! <br><br>The entire visit took over 2.5 hours to receive our food, eat and leave. <br><br>I will try the restaurant on 119th Street. I know I will not visit this location for a very long time. :-(

Charged me $30 for an unseasoned dry filet. I ask for steak sauce. They only have A1. I had to put dirt sauce on a $30 steak just because they didn&#39;t season it properly. I inform manager. Manager offers to remake my steak with seasoning :( after sitting in there waiting for an hour and then being disappointed with what I got the last thing I wanted to do was wait for another steak and eat it while the person I was with had already finished eating before the manager even arrived. Pro tip for managing a high scale establishment Take $30 unseasoned piece of meat off my bill and maybe I would come back to your restaurant to give you a second chance.

I decided to go with my usual, I started with crispy crab bites, then shepherd pie, slice of caramel pecan turtle cheesecake with a passion fruit mojito.  The foods is always freshly prepared and home-made.  I wish I could keep the Cheesecake Factory all to myself.  For this reason, I recommend going to any Cheesecake Factory for a slice of cheesecake.

All of the non-cheesecake food at the cheesecake factory is 3 stars.  Some things border on the edge of being 4 star worthy while others may droop closer to the 2 star level.  Everything is fine, if but a bit pricey (but hey, welcome to the plaza).  This location has a small bar area that keeps everything from relatively inexpensive good wine and baseline booze; i.e. Jack Daniels, Smirnoff, etc. on up to the better stuff; i.e. Macallan 12.  <br><br>Wait, why did you come here to eat something other than cheesecake?  If you&#39;re on the plaza, there&#39;s a plethora of other lunch/dinner joints.  Come here afterwards for the cheesecake.  So far, I&#39;ve tried about 15 different varieties and have never been disappointed.  They stay true to the namesake and offer up the best cheesecake in town.  From Dulce de Leche to the Tiramisu (my favorite) all the way to plain Jane and Godiva chocolate.  You can&#39;t go wrong.  Even if this place is just on your way home, grab some dessert from the to go area and treat yourself.

I have been to this location quite a few times and it&#39;s always delicious. It&#39;s a 2 hour drive from my house but it&#39;s worth it!<br><br>My group of 3 enjoyed everything we ate. I love the tex mex egg rolls with the delicious avocado dipping sauce. Today I had the grilled chicken avocado club and it was so yummy. The toast on that sandwich is so buttery but with just the right amount of crispness and delicious seasoned mayo. I do love their cheesecake but the regular carrot cake is amazing!<br><br>Our waitress was also great.

Pros: The food was very tasty and the service was decent. The Honey and Bourbon cocktail was pretty good.<br><br>Cons: I get that restaurants have to make money. But, there&#39;s a point in time when you need to just tell people you can&#39;t serve them until the place clears out a bit. Yes, it was a Saturday afternoon and the wait was expected (1hr and 30 mins) but people were JAM PACKED in there, waiting up and down the steps and the lobby stayed packed with people the entire time we were there. It not only crammed everyone waiting but the people actually eating had to be shoved in a table while there was a huge crowd around, making it hard to get in and out not to mention the bathrooms were a mess. They do not have a changing table so we had to use a small area to change and it was just miserable. <br><br>The fettuccine alfredo with chicken was really good and tasty but the experience was pretty bleh.

What an absolute shit show on Mother&#39;s Day. No social distancing was enforced. And dozens of people waiting outside to finally get their food and for it to be cold. The lack of organization is incredible. I hope all the people get an apology for this.

Haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in along time.  A friend asked me if I wanted to go to Lunch. I had my car in the shop so Lunch was good.   My friend ask me months ago if I want to go to The Cheesecake Factory and I kept blow her off.   One thing I forgot about The Cheesecake Factory prices are off the roof.  To be honest I gave the restaurant three stars on service.  I ordered soup which was Chicken tortilla but it was so dang Bland that I couldn&#39;t eat it.  Chicken Salad was my sandwich and it was horrible.   Maybe I should have ordered desert
Love the avocado rolls, breakfast items, strawberry lemonade and the coffee cheesecake. The wait for a table was typical of Cheesecake Factory, lunchtime

Two months ago I went on a Friday night for happy hour.  They were out of one of the items I ordered, but didn&#39;t tell me.  I waited and waited.  They finally told me and I ordered something else.  It came out hot on the outside but still cold on the inside.  Manager comped my meal.<br>I tried again on Friday, October 18th and once more they were out of one of the items I ordered.  I ordered something else.  This is Friday after noon between 4 and 5!!!  How do you 86 an item so soon before the weekend?  As I was waiting the bartenders were busy talking to each other and I had to ask for bread.  One of them said, &#34;Certainly&#34;.  It never came.  I don&#39;t know where the managers are, or what they are thinking.  I won&#39;t be back.  Too many other good restaurants on the plaza who take care of the guests.

The architecture is a confusing mashup and so is the food. Some food items are done excellently and some are... not excellent. It is very clean and upscale, they also have quite the patio and fountain- they definitely have a great location!

We went around 7 and had a 15 (or less) minute wait. That&#39;s not a long wait for such a busy place. It was kind of hard to hear each other, because the general ambience is loud. Tables are so close together. My husband had the jambalaya (with rice instead of pasta) and I had the parmesan-garlic chicken. He wasn&#39;t super impressed with his meal (he thought it needed more sauce), but I thought my meal was delicious!

I haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in a while but I was craving a slice of cheesecake so we decided to stop in.  Although we had already eaten dinner, we ordered the fried zucchini appetizer and a banana cheesecake. The fried zucchini was crispy and hot.  My husband and I love fried zucchini and it was nice that it wasn&#39;t cut too thin and was cooked perfectly.  It comes paired with ranch dressing.  The cheesecake was delicious as well.  It had a slight banana flavor that didn&#39;t overpower the cheesecake with a side of fresh bananas and whipped cream. Our waiter was friendly even though we only came to eat a snack and dessert.  Definitely will return to eat since I&#39;m usually a fan of Cheesecake Factory.

We don&#39;t eat at chain restaurants very often, but so far, our experiences with this Cheesecake Factory have mostly been good.<br><br>We have come here numerous times for a quick dinner on a weeknight and several times for brunch. Our service has ranged anywhere from excellent to terrible (only terrible one time though) and I really think that depends on who you get as your server.<br><br>The brunch is definitely more outstanding to me than the dinners. The waffle with whipped cream, candied pecans and fresh strawberries is incredible. I could literally eat it every Sunday and never complain.<br><br>The food here is very consistent and is always good. The extensive menu holds several options for everyone, which is nice.

The menu is too big, but I assume this place ties its existence to the quality of the cheesecake. To that end, they came through. Everyone at my table was pleased with the dessert. The main courses blew no one away. Solid, but not game-changing.
I ordered the steak medallions with Herb crusted salmon.  She had truffle honey chicken.  Good was great service was awesome, I just would like a bigger portions..Lol.

Wow, really bad service tonight. Followed the instructions on the website for Curbside to go. Stated during the order it was for Curbside to go. Arrive at the Plaza location band cannot find designated parking, so call the restaurant to ask where they were. Were then told, uh, we don&#39;t like take food outside. Ok, go inside to pick up our order and stood, ignored for 4 minutes (yes we times it, at this point, why not?) Treated very rudely by staff once someone came over to the to go counter. <br>Not happy, and probably not returning.

As usual the wait was about 45mins to an hour. We shopped at forever 21 while we waited. We finally got seated and got our drinks pretty quick. We all prefer the baked potato soup and it was not hot. I ordered the Louisiana pasta and it was delicious. We all ordered cheesecake to go and it took almost 20 mins for us to get our cheesecake. I got the Hershey&#39;s cheesecake and it was delicious! My friend ordered the Parmesan chicken with broccoli and she said it was good and the portion was big.

I&#39;ve spent 20 years in the restaurant business from dishwasher to franchisee. After selling my stores I took a break to spend time with my family. On a whim I recently began freelance delivery for one of these popular menu aggregator platforms. It passes the time and I get to explore and discover our city like never before. Now, I&#39;ve always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory and I am a patron. I have found that it&#39;s the most popular high ppa concept I work with through this aggregator. Last night I went in to pick up a couple of large orders and they were absolutely slammed. This person I have repeatedly interacted with now was working and, as all ways, was performing with grace under fire. Today I had free time so I went back out and took another large CCF offer. Norma again was working. I overheard her manager tell her she had been singled out, put in a bad light in a Yelp review by grumpy guests. Norma even had her photo secretly taken and these people added it to this page! This staff, especially the gals that work the takeout counter (the busiest I&#39;ve ever seen!) are incredibly hardworking. I&#39;m the least pretentious guy you&#39;d meet and to them I&#39;m just a driver. But they are kind, gracious and responsive to me as if I were a tipping customer. I highly recommend this restaurant, the food is fantastic and aesthetically perfect. The guest service is high-level. You won&#39;t be disappointed. Here&#39;s the real Norma.

Not the worst service but certainly not the best. Order the Jamaican pepper shrimp and chicken. Presentation is everything so with that being said I give 3 &#39;s for presentation. Food was colder then it should be and the fried plantains, BURNT! Look I&#39;ve probably been cooking longer then you&#39;ve been alive...please don&#39;t tell me how plantains are &#34;supposed&#34; to be. Burnt is burnt and when I tell you it&#39;s burnt you replace them them still burnt and undercook, mushy plantains! Turn the fire down genius allow to cook within and then cook til golden...NOT BLACK! The photos below are just examples of how plantains should look.

Not to happy with them. Short wait to sit, that&#39;s about the only plus. Waiter is slow, then when food came out, he uses pot holders and hands my kids scalding hot plates. Dry burgers, food is just okay. Dessert is good, can&#39;t really screw up cheesecake/sugar.

I love the Cheesecake Factory. I don&#39;t know if it is their 20 page menu or the endless baskets of warm bread and butter that keep me coming back. I just know I leave this place happy almost every time.<br><br>My favorite menu item is the chicken belagio. It is a huge plate of food, so my wife and I always share. It is two large pieces of breaded chicken topped with prosciutto and arugula, served on a mountain of pasta bathed in a pesto/alfredo type sauce. It&#39;s amazing. In my opinion, this specific location made it better than all the others I&#39;ve been to. <br><br>I&#39;m giving this location 5 stars for the food, service, and location. After eating at the Cheesecake Factory during my travels to California and elsewhere I almost swore off this restaurant for good. These other locations had horrible service and the effort they put into making their food was severely lacking. For example, the pasta had very little sauce on it, and it looked/tasted like it sat out for over an hour. <br><br>Of course you can&#39;t leave without getting a slice of cheesecake. We have probably tried over half of them by now. I don&#39;t think you can go wrong with any of them.
Food extremely dry &amp; cold  establishment is very dark in lighting. Server not attentive and it isn&#39;t busy.

I&#39;m scoring a 3... average.  That explains our visit quite well.  <br><br>We had average service.  Our waitress was nice, courteous, and friendly.  She just had too many tables and could not provide us the quality of service we expected.  Tea and water glasses were empty many times.<br><br>My wife enjoyed her salad, a new kale and quinoa salad.  It was good.  She normally doesn&#39;t do salads.  I asked her what&#39;s up?  Her reply... at least I&#39;m expecting it to be cold.<br><br>A great set up... my meal was supposed to come heated.  It was a cold Steak Diane.  Cooked right, good flavor, but cold.  They also forgot my grilled onions.  I wanted to complain.  My wife encouraged me not to as we were there with others.  It was their night to celebrate.  She didn&#39;t want us to make a fuss.<br><br>So this visit reinforced our feeling we had prior to coming tonight.  We come for the fellowship, not for the food.

Been to this location a couple of times . <br>I always get the Shrimp and chicken Gumbo . I believe it&#39;s a Jamaican inspired dish - <br>It&#39;s a little on the spicy side but nothing unbearable, it&#39;s a great first choice , depending on what you like.<br>Portions are large so expect to have leftovers. <br>Overall delicious food and of course what is dinner without cheesecake.<br>They have a Fantastic selection of cheesecake- I always get the Mango cheesecake its not too sweet So it works for me. <br>I&#39;ve also tried there happy hour drinks - I got the Mojito and cosmopolitan (great drink selection) and presentation.<br>Definitely recommend coming to this location

It seems to me that The Cheesecake Factory and consistency are synonymous. Any one of their locations I have been to around the nation has been solid. I have been to this location a handful of times and can say that I have had all great experiences. Being on the Plaza though, this location can be packed to the gills with people along with a wait that is longer than an hour on a weekend night in summer. Happy hour here is the way to go for cheap eats and great drinks. Don&#39;t forget to save room for cheesecake, though!

So after arriving and setting out side 2 table around me and the 4 waitress that are here no one is asking me if I want help or anything. Even after they all are looking at me. This is horrible service I&#39;ve been sweating here for 25mins and no one is asking me if I want water or anything. <br><br>Trying to tell me that I am not in a section that is yet in service. Even tho there are multiple people around me that are being serviced...... this place is agents homosexuals. It&#39;s quite obvious. <br><br>This will be the last and only time that I&#39;ll be coming to this place. I called a head and was told to set anyplace that I liked outside. This is just a big joke on the service of the place. I had to call the store to get a server to serve my section. Because I was one table to the left of what was being &#34; served&#34; I&#39;m like what the fuck. This place is just trying to screw people over.
Returned at the request of my daughter visting from out of town. Service was great and friendly. Glad I gave it a second visit.
It&#39;s an expensive meal, but the meal is great nonetheless. The cheesecake is to die for. Any meal on the menu is great but don&#39;t get lasagna verda! it&#39;s not good!

Food was great, but my service was TERRIBLE, just because i am 17 does NOT mean i dont tip good, i ALWAYS leave 20% or more because i work in restaurants and i depend on tips sometimes and i understand the importance but this waitress did not help us, check on us, we asked for another fork and she told us to go get it ourselves at the front??? NOT GOING AGAIN. I get better service at McDonald&#39;s and spend wayyyy less

Great location. Has beautiful outdoor seating but it was a bit humid out so changed our minds and sat inside. Server was on point and accommodating. Our go to firecracker salmon was delicious. Asked about a certain dish since it had shrimp and plantains but it said very spicy which I didn&#39;t want. So I opted for my go to shrimp with angel hair and he got me a side of plantains! Oh so happy! My daughter always gets the chipotle chicken pasta which she loves and the lunch portion is plenty with some for dinner! Bathroom is upstairs and restaurant was clean. Enjoyed our visit.
Mr Akolade G. gave my family perfect service tonight. If I owned a restaurant, he&#39;d be working for me. Great food too.

This was my first time at cheesecake factory and I am in love. They have an extensive menu with so many food choices it was hard to make a decision. Because this was my first time I decided to eat small and save room for cheesecake! I tried the crab bites they came with mustard sauce and i loved them. They were crispy on the outside and soft and flavorful on the inside. My friends also had chicken &#39;taquitos and cheeseburger spring rolls. Both were very happy with their choices as well. We all had different cheesecake and each piece was wonderful!

It&#39;s a bit of a Christmas season tradition for our family to make at least one trip to the Plaza for frolicking around under the glimmering Christmas lights and enjoying a nice, festive dinner by the windows of a nice restaurant, watching passers by as we eat.<br><br>This year, we landed at Cheesecake Factory for the aforementioned meal.<br><br>Yes, I know that CF on a holiday weekend is slightly ill-advised, but we had a giftcard, and with kids in tow, you just can&#39;t go wrong with their mega-menu.<br><br>We thought we&#39;d beat the rush by arriving at 4:45.  We thought, &#34;Oh, maybe we&#39;ll wait a few minutes, but surely we&#39;ll miss the 2-3 hour wait.&#34;<br><br>Dead wrong.<br><br>Name went in at 4:45.  We were told it would be a 90 minute wait.  Ugggh.  Will the kids make it?  Should we go somewhere else?  Ehh, by the time we walk 15 minutes back to the car, drive 10-30 minutes somewhere else, undoubtedly wait a few minutes there...we might as well have stayed.  So we did.<br><br>After an hour and forty minutes, I went to check up on where we were at within the line.  <br><br>&#34;It&#39;ll be about another 25 minutes.&#34;<br><br>Double uggggghhh.<br><br>Forty-five minutes later, our buzzer buzzed and we were shown to a (windowless) table by the kitchen.  But, by that time, we were ready to eat eight-day old garbage within a dirty, third-world ghetto, so it didn&#39;t really matter.  And, also, we found great &#34;seats&#34; (window sills) inside, upstairs, outside the bathrooms that we sat at for about half our wait.  The view was Plaza-Christmas-tastic!<br><br>The food was as the food is at Cheesecake Factory - solid.  As it should be, the namesake dessert was F A N T A S T I C.  I can&#39;t recall the exact name, but lots of Nutella and hazelnuts were involved.<br><br>Table service was just slightly under-average for Cheesecake Factory, but the dude said he had been working since open, which would have had him there well-past a normal shift.  A little goofy, but still attentive, helpful, and half-way charming...in a sleepy way.<br><br>Were it not for the grossly inaccurate estimates for wait times (for which I&#39;ve docked them on &#34;Service&#34; below), the overall for this location would have scored a bit better.  I&#39;ll make sure to provide an updated review next time we&#39;re in on a non-holiday weekend to give ol&#39; CF a fair shake.<br><br>Food = 4/5 <br>Facility = 4/5<br>Service = 1/5<br>Ambiance = 2/5<br>Value = 3/5

We&#39;ve always been a fan of this location but yikes. Just took a family friend out for her birthday. We were basically ignored by our waitress for an hour. Our chicken dish arrived very pink. The manager eventually came over and apologized, took the dish off our bill, which was appreciated. But the service was just lacking and kind of a bummer. My mom had to remind the waitress twice about it being our friend&#39;s birthday. When reminded, she reluctantly said something like, &#34;oh... I could do a small sundae...&#34; Just a lot of waiting and lackluster service. Big shrug.

Great selection of items to choose from.  Our server  Kool Aid was amazing - made great recommendations for entrees and made sure we had plenty to drink.  Chicken Riesling was amazing!  Too bad we were too full to get dessert!

This was one of my worst experiences ever. I&#39;m going to assume that it&#39;s because it was a busy Saturday night but it was still poor service. I came in around 8:45 and asked for a table for 17 (8 adults and 9 children) which is understandably a large party. The hostess looked at me like I had 3 heads.<br>Then says &#39;I&#39;ll have to get my manager&#39;. Then he came out and likewise looked at me like I had 3 heads. He then tells me it&#39;ll be a 2hr wait. I&#39;m ok with that because of our size (a birthday party). Hostess says &#39;contact your party and come back and let us know what you decide&#39;. I already decided ma&#39;am. So we wait. After an hour I got a buzzer (which she reluctantly handed me). We still wait. After it had gone PAST the 2 hour mark with no updates from staff or manager my party decided to leave and order to go. Nobody asked me if I wanted that or checked on me. I then had to wait in that line another 20 min. Then they tell me the food will be another 20min (ended up being 30+). My food was burned by the time I got it open at home. Manager walked past me SEVERAL times and said NOTHING. I will NEVER visit this establishment again.
Extremely poor service.<br><br>Manager not managing.<br><br>Messed up 3 orders!!!<br><br>Used to be a favorite place ... not sure how they messed up so badly.

I really like this place! Great food with nice scenery while you eat. I had the jambalaya which had plantains and black beans with a jerk taste to the shrimp and chicken. Real Caribbean style dish and it was delicious.
What can I say, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory.  The service was good, food was good but the best thing was the bartender made one of the best dirty martinis in have ever had.

Super food, very creative with their salads, soups and flatbreads.<br>My sister&#39;s on a vegetable based diet, the waitress went out of her way to accommodate her needs. Plus she loved what she ordered as did I.

Cheesecake Factory, a must visit if you&#39;re hungry.  They have redefined portion size to the detriment of the American Waistline...but when the food is good, you might as well get a lot if it.<br><br>The space is not overwhelming, but a theater type atmosphere with tons of booths and tables.  There is a spiral staircase that takes you to extra seating, and a not so handy bathroom.  The nicely dressed servers give a dressy appearance, but cheesecake is super casual, additionally reinforced once you open the novel length menu.  Page after page of delicious entrees temp you on every level.  Only the truly adventurous foodies would dare order an appetizer, as the mammoth main dishes are sized to feed two.<br><br>We went for a lighter meal this evening, my son grabbed the omelet, and fixings.  Nice size meal, good flavor, but it&#39;s hard to screw up breakfast, even in a factory of cheesecakes.  I had the chicken pasta with asparagus.  The pasta and chicken were perfect, adding a light pesto, did the trick on my taste buds...try the smaller portions if you want to enjoy one of their many cheesecake offerings...none for me...I have a dairy allergy that keeps me away from those sinful treats...<br><br>Go to cheesecake, if you&#39;re hungry, otherwise, be prepared to eat the same dish a couple times...LO central...

Every time I&#39;ve come to this location I have always had excellent customer service. The Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant so for any occasion I come here. This time it was my boyfriend&#39;s birthday and he didn&#39;t want anything major so we came here and I informed our waiter. Our waiter brought out our cheesecake of choice with &#34;Happy Birthday&#34; written on the plate. Was a really nice gesture. I love the food here, I always get the Chicken Piccata and it&#39;s always amazing. He loves getting the Cajun pasta/jambalaya. There lunch menu is a really good value too. I have such a sweet tooth so I&#39;m still trying to try every flavor of cheesecake, about halfway there.

My husband and I LOVE Cheesecake Factory! Some complain that it is too pricey, but my husband and I always share an entree because the portion sizes are huge! You are always treated with warm delicious bread before your meal and I&#39;ve never had anything at Cheesecake I didn&#39;t like. Do yourself a favor and order the Chicken Bellagio, and it is the CHEESECAKE Factory...so getting a slice of cheesecake is a must!

About as Average as you can get. <br>There are so many great options in the plaza area, this should be your near to last choice. <br><br>Wait times in the plaza can be 2-3 hours on a Friday night. Most places take reservations. TCF does not, and also does not do call ahead seating. They do have a nice outdoor waiting area and a few good shops near by to visit while you wait.<br><br>The restaurant it self is your standard Cheesecake Factory. A big menu full of average to bland food. If you&#39;re set on making a stop here, save it for dessert or light lunch.
Avocado Egg rolls, Chicken Madeira, and Cheese Cake!!! Service was excellent. The bartender made an excellent mojito while waiting for our seats.

Always busy but that&#39;s a sign of a great place to eat. Didn&#39;t wait long and service was prompt and efficient. Got the Thai chicken lettuce wraps for a healthy start and ended with the lemon raspberry cheesecake! Took home a low carb options (which is great to have this option!)<br>Always yummy

Better hope nothing goes wrong with your meal because they won&#39;t refund you, even after saying they will. I&#39;m pregnant and all I wanted on Christmas eve was some fettuccine alfredo. I live right by this location and my boyfriend has had to make several runs to pick me up some food from The Cheesecake Factory. I placed an order for pickup directly on their website for some fettuccine alfredo along with a Margherita pizza for my boyfriend and a slice of cheesecake for the both of us. It came out to about $55. He went and picked it up. The fettuccine alfredo was overwhelmingly garlicky but I dealt with it. About six bites in, I find a hair. It&#39;s clearly not mine or my boyfriend&#39;s hair. I instantly lost my appetite and actually gagged a bit and almost threw up. I was still in my bad morning sickness stage and it hit me hard. I couldn&#39;t finish my meal or eat my cheesecake. My boyfriend was pretty annoyed that the hair was in my food since I hadn&#39;t been able to eat in days and he was happy I finally had an appetite. He called the store and was told that they needed to get a manager for us. He&#39;s on hold for ten minutes when someone else greets him and then puts him on hold again while they find a manager... Five minutes later and an apologetic manager tells him he will refund the pasta and a slice of cheesecake back to my card. Two weeks later, I still have a full charge on my bank app and no refund anywhere. He calls again. Same dance with the &#34;hold while I get a manager&#34; game, twice. Then a manager comes and tells him that it just takes a while to process the refund and we should have it by the next week. We&#39;ll, I&#39;ve been waiting for my refund for almost a month now. Still nothing. I guess I need to call the bank and issue a charge back. This is ridiculous. You lost a good customer. A pregnant girl that usually loves your food and she&#39;s right next to your store? Should have just given us our money back. Bad form. I&#39;ll leave a bad review every where I can now.

What can I say...the menu is so extensive it would be hard not to find something that you like.  Personally, I think they are trying to do too much and many dishes aren&#39;t very good, so I have my go-to items and pretty much only order those all the time.<br><br>It&#39;s very busy most of the time and there&#39;s usually a wait.  Our waiter was ok, but didn&#39;t really have time to go above and beyond in terms of service.<br><br>In short...nothing is going to &#34;wow&#34; you about the Cheesecake Factory, but it&#39;s a solid place.  Decent prices and huge portions.

The presentation of the food was kinda messy but the flavors were there. What can you really expect from a large chain like this, though? <br>Service was mediocre, at best. The server promptly took our drink orders but brought the wrong drinks so she let us have the wrong drinks for free along with the ones we actually ordered, which would have been great had I actually liked what she brought.  The rest of the night we had to search for her. Maybe she was embarrassed but we had look for her to place our food order, get drink refills, and get the check. <br>Hopefully it&#39;ll be better next time.

They don&#39;t take reservations, so our party of 10 came on a Saturday around 2:45. We knew we&#39;d have to wait, and the hostess said an hour and fifteen to an hour an forty five. It took about an hour and fifteen. We were sat and we were close to the door and with the line out the door most of the time, the chilly air plagued us most of the meal.<br><br>We froze, but were pretty hungry due to being there for a while. I liked my Romano chicken. The chicken itself was tasty, but the pasta was a bit bland. We had an amazing server that kept up with us. He was friendly and very professional.<br><br>I feel I&#39;ve consistently had mediocre, non-memorable experiences here. The whole time we were eating, more and more people crammed around us, causing an unpleasant atmosphere to eat in.

My wife and I have been coming to cheesecake factory for many new year eves. The menu is extensive and the food is pretty good but a little expensive.<br><br>Service has been good every time but was disappointed this past new years. They did pass out champaign but no party favors. No biggie but that&#39;s part of why we go every year.<br><br>So! If you want cheese cake, yes this is the place to go. If you want a fancy dining experience, head on over. Good selection of great tasting food and good service...yes.<br><br>There will always be a place in my stomach for the cheesecake factory but it&#39;s only for cheesecake and/or new years eve celebrations. If you haven&#39;t been and want a fancy dinner...I&#39;d recommend it.

So I had a gift card...I decided to come in and get the factory meatloaf that never disappoints. It&#39;s about 830 and I know the staff is preparing to close but the service was sub par. No receptionist at the front. I came to the bar the bar tender appeared after 5 minutes. My meal was amazing but I had no silverware, no bartender to get them, and the counter is filthy. I&#39;m just sitting waiting for a box at this point and it&#39;s been a quite some time... I&#39;ll be back but this is not the deal..
Busy and slow.  I like the Cheesecake Factory but the wait staff is very slow at this location.  Besides that hat the food is great!

We chose cheesecake over shake shack because we wanted a nice, enjoyable dining experience. From the host that greeted us with a scowl and poor attitude, Luke warm lunch food that took over an hour and came out 15 minutes a part for a table of two, to the frozen cheesecake...I can&#39;t Recommend this as an option to family or friends.

I would not normally come here unless I was bribed with free cheesecake. I attended a work dinner and wondered why they had to choose this place.... it&#39;s not the worst place ever, but chains aren&#39;t my first choice for a Friday night dinner. <br><br>We waited about two hours for a table. Yeah, it was a Friday night but waiting is never fun. I really wondered why so many people lined up for this restaurant when there are so many better restaurants. <br><br>The menu has wayyy, way too much. Bad sign in my opinion. This place was insanely busy, so my first thought was, &#34;What is something that they cannot mess up?&#34; I chose the Fried Macaroni and CheeseBurger&#34;. While this is something I would never usually order, I figured it would be delicious and fail proof. It turns out it was freaking delicious. Out of our party of ten, pretty much everyone agreed they should have ordered what I did. Everyone else complained or was dissatisfied with what they ordered. I agreed - none of their food looked good. Things were over-sauced and over-seasoned. <br><br>Our server sucked. I will never understand why people wait two hours for overpriced food with the risk of crappy service.

We took our God- daughter for a birthday meal. The wait was over 30 minutes which I wouldn&#39;t have waited that long if not for her looking forward to it. The service was pretty good, can&#39;t complain. Now the food, my wife tried a Mexican corn cake chicken taco/enchilada plate that she didn&#39;t love. She said the black beans were dry flavorless, they called the tacos but by my photos, they&#39;re enchiladas. I think the chef may be a Gringo. Our God-daughter had the orange chicken which looked great and her and my wife liked it. I tried the Cajun jambalaya which was good but the the value isn&#39;t there for almost $18 (noodles, couple shrimp, chicken and spices are pretty cheap. They make a killing on that order. White chocolate chip macadamia nut cheesecake kept it from being a &#34;2&#34; overall. It&#39;s definitely only a place I&#39;ll go if I&#39;m taking nieces, nephews etc.

I have tried New York steak and Key Lime Cheesecake, both are great!<br>And the service is great too. We ordered for 4 people and a friend came and joined us. They helped to join 2 tables for us although we can add a chair in the 4 seats table.<br>Personally I highly recommend. lol
This is probably my favorite cheesecake place but the wait is so long and its always filled inside even filled if people are not eating. But the food is really good.

One star to many;; <br>on a constant awful service (not from just one visit but multiple visits)<br><br>Food is usually wrong; or tastes awful.<br>Management has not accountability for poor service/ wrong orders/ mishaps etc.<br><br>If you want to enjoy your food/ atmosphere etc I would avoid this place.

We came on a Friday night at 7:00pm, and waited 80 minutes (wait time was expected; not the reason for the 2-stars).  Here&#39;s all the things that were wrong:<br>1) There were eight people in our party and the server only brought out two bread baskets.  There should have been at least 3 or 4.  <br><br>2) There were times when our server disappeared for extended periods of time.  He dropped off bread and disappeared for fifteen minutes, and we had to keep asking for bread.<br><br>3) I ordered the Crispy Chicken Costaletta, and the meat was dry.  Usually, there&#39;s a tangy cream sauce that the chicken breasts lay on top of, but there was barely any on my plate.  I didn&#39;t even bother asking for more, because our server disappeared after dropping off our food and didn&#39;t even come by to check if everything was alright until our food was halfway eaten.<br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at a handful of Cheesecake Factory locations across the United States, and this one was the worst.  Poor service &amp; poor quality food--not worth the money.  Only ONE out of the EIGHT in our party enjoyed their food.  I sure am noticing poor-quality trend in mid-West chain restaurants...

First of all the people was racist. I did order my food and did not like it. I did not eat it then the manager told me that I had to pay. Server never came by to the table to ask if the doos was good. They made a scene like I was stealing. I paid them and left but their food was left untouched on the table. <br>I will never go back there nor will my family or my friends. I felt very disappointed and disrespectful. Cheesecake Factory, never again!!!

Food wasn&#39;t done. Too much fat meat on my meat. Terrible customer service. Employees had bad attitudes. Very small food portions. Items were missing from my order. My meal was so greasy the food was floating in grease! Reported the problem to the manager and the manager didn&#39;t care. The manager had an attitude problem too!

I love the Mango Key Lime cheesecake here and that is always what I order prior to my meal!  Our recent visit was an OK visit.  I enjoy the atmosphere along with the patio seating when it is a nice day.  I will say though I was not happy with the wait though.... We waited a long time to order our water and then for it to arrive and the place was not very busy.  We never got checked on when we ate desert first and then when we were done we finally were asked what we wanted for dinner.  Dinner came out in less than 10 minutes, way to fast, I was not ready for food to come out so fast and super hot on the plate so I knew it was super fresh!  We ordered a popular pasta marina dish with two large pieces of crusted chicken, amazing!  The flavors at cheesecake factory are amazing I just don&#39;t always receive the best service here from the employees.

Even though the Cheesecake Factory is in the Plaza area it is pretty hard to find. It has a sign that says &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;. There is a very nice garden/fountain in a little courtyard. When you walk in, there is a big display case just full of cheesecakes. I like to admire them while I wait. There is a lot of seating. And that&#39;s probably a good thing. They get a lot of people at the Cheesecake Factory. As you wait you can look at the TV. It shows a slideshow of all the food and cheesecakes plus the names of all of them. Speaking of food, even for a cheesecake place they have the best food EVER. I got Skinnylicious Chicken Enchiladas and let me tell you they are to die for!!<br><br>Now for the thing you have been waiting for: the cheesecakes. They are also to die for. There are so many different flavors that you can choose from. There are fruit flavors and chocolate flavors and crazy flavors and original flavors, I could go on and on. My favorite is the Reese&#39;s Peanut Putter Cup Cheesecake. If you like peanut butter, chocolate and cheesecake you will love this one! That being said, they are all good. This time though I got the Peppermint Bark Cheesecake. It was fabulously good. It has candy canes inside it too!! This place is the best. I would totally recommend going here for any meal (except breakfast).
Favorite place to eat at the Plaza in Kansas City! The cheesecake is wonderful save room for dessert!
Great service even for a busy Saturday afternoon. Great food as always. Waiter we had was phenomenal. Will be back again next time.
It is a great restaurant and our waiter got our food out in a snap he was very king and he asked us to refill our drinks this place is a five star restaurant

Every time I have gone to The Cheesecake Factory I always get something different. This last time I went (1/1/18) I tried the Chicken Bellagio. It is now my favorite dish &amp; will definitely get it next time I go. Our server was very friendly and informative about the menu. I will definitely try to go back more!

Well there you go!<br>Completely happy with this place! I&#39;ve been to many of them but this one really set the bar. Extremely friendly staff, well organized and really nice. <br>I had a huge family et together and we had a blast. I haven&#39;t been in Kansas City in years and we had a blast.<br>I had the salmon on a bed of brown rice. I also had their IPA to wash everything doe with.<br>The salmon was amazing!!!! And the rice had a little bit of sauce on it. It was none the less amazing too haha.<br>Thank you for a great experience! Happy holidays.

Just called to make reservations for out of town company.  Even though site has a check mark for reservations, it is ONLY for the FIRST HOUR of operation, which is 11 to Noon...oh and you HAVE TO EAT THERE
Cheesecake is amazing! The food was ok. Do not order the Cajun pasta with chicken and shrimp, it has no flavor for $20. The lettuce wraps are good. Nice atmosphere.

Really disappointing experience here last night. I&#39;d called earlier in the day to verify the happy hour was 4-6. My friend &amp; I arrived at 4:45. Seeing the downstairs bar full, we headed to the upstairs bar where I&#39;ve sat before. We were told it wasn&#39;t open yet, but would be in about 30 minutes.... We went back downstairs to see if any spots had opened up yet &amp; they hadn&#39;t. I asked the hostess what she recommended (thinking she might offer to seat us near the bar &amp; still let us enjoy the happy hour pricing) and she offered nothing.  I asked if we just needed to go someplace else and she &#39;guessed so&#39;.  The good news is we went to Plaza 3 to enjoy their happy hour and had a great experience! (Loaded house made potato chips with blue cheese &amp; bacon $3.95, tenderloin skewers $3.95, prime rib sliders $ 5.95- many other choices very reasonably priced!) <br>At the end of the night we went back to The Cheesecake Factory to get a couple pieces of cheesecake to go. While there was a very large crowd of people waiting to be seated, the line for to go orders was only about 8 deep. It took OVER 30 MINUTES for us to finally get to place our order for cheesecake and then at least another 5 minutes to get our cheesecake to go.<br>Serious management problems here with planning and execution.

There was a long wait to get inside, but it was a Saturday without reservations downtown. It was definitely worth the wait. Cheesecake Factory is famous for cheesecake for a reason. <br><br>I had the s&#39;mores cheesecake covered it hot fudge paired with the pineapple mojito. Both were fantastic! I was too excited to snap a picture of the cheesecake. I split the cheesecake with my boyfriend. It&#39;s extremely heavy and delicious, but it&#39;s too much to eat in one sitting. You&#39;ll need to take it home or split with at least one other person. Whew! I can&#39;t imagine having dessert  and dinner here. Wow. I would love to come back as try their delicious dinner entrees. I&#39;ll be back! Wonderful service and tasty desserts. What&#39;s not to love?!

We went to celebrate one of my friends birthday.  We ordered Thai lettuce wraps, avocado rolls and fried macaroni.  Everything was perfect and delicious until we found a hair in the Thai wraps.  That may have ruined our lunch appetite but didn&#39;t let it ruin the chance to order cheesecake for desert.  If it wasn&#39;t for Carlos and the fantastic serving; I would have given this two stars.  But his service made up for the hair in the food.

One of my family&#39;s favorite places to go whenever we find one from the Galleria in the San Fernando Valley, Beverly Hills or here in our new location Leawood, KS. This time we went to the Plaza location to see the lights and do a little shopping while we waited the estimated 1.5 to 2 hours for a table of eight. An hour and 45 minutes later we were seated. We ordered five pastas, A Cheeseburger, Chicken Madeira and a Cuban Sandwich. It took about 15 minutes to get a drink order in and delivered, I get it, it&#39;s busy. The waiter asked if we wanted bread, who doesn&#39;t? Finally, about 25-30 minutes later the food started arriving to the table. We all are waiting to eat until everyone is served, and I noticed the only one who doesn&#39;t get a plate was my wife. She is the main reason we are there. The one who needs a night off after making the holidays perfect for everyone else. I hear the waiter say &#34;your Cheeseburger was accidently taken to another table it will be about two to three minutes to get a new one. My wife tells us all to start eating and we do. Literally after everyone is finished or stopped eating because they are full the cheeseburger arrives to the table. Of course, this is upsetting and really took the enjoyment out of A $265.52 dinner. As disappointed as I was watching my wife take just a couple bites before asking for a to-go container, I was floored when the check came to the table. Absolutely nothing off the tab and an automatic 18% GRATUITY plugged in! In my 25 years of restaurant work myself I have never complained to another manager, that was over. I contacted the manager about what accrued, and he said he was aware of the mistake and was sorry. I asked &#34;that&#39;s it? I said they even still charged the $14.95 for the cheeseburger, do you think that&#39;s right? He said he would remove it and did. That was it. The name says it all. The Cheesecake Factory, It&#39;s run and operated like a profit maximizing factory

I like this place and have been to many throughout the country.  Their menu is always somewhat overwhelming but the food and service is generally pretty good.  This Kansas City location in particular has been very good, always offering up friendly service and good quality food items.  Today I tried the Gumbo which was nicely presented and had plenty of shrimp and meat but was slightly on the bland side.  I also chose the Asian Shrimp Spring Rolls which were very good and came with two very nice dipping sauces.  <br><br>This is the Cheese Cake Factory and their specialty is cheese cake!  Unfortunately, I had no room for desert today but I&#39;ve had their cheese cake before and it&#39;s good!  All their baked goods are excellent.  I could eat their bread all day long! As chain restaurants go, this one is very good.

I have to admit that my guilty pleasure lies in a creamy, majestic piece of Cheesecake Factory cheesecake. I don&#39;t care if they&#39;re a chain or even if their cheesecake is frozen....I love it. One piece can make a meal and I write their 1/2 price Cheesecake Day on my calendar like it&#39;s a National Holiday. The White Chocolate Raspberry and Mango Key Lime are both top runners for favorite flavor. <br><br>Now I&#39;m hungry.

I&#39;ve not been here in a while. I limit my sweets so when I come for cheesecake it&#39;s special. I was excited about tonight. I haven&#39;t had cheesecake in like 5-6 months. I had it narrowed down to 4 flavors. Lemon Meringue, Carrot Cake, Lemon Raspberry or Cherry Ghirardelli. The waiter was like the Ghirardelli Cherry is the absolute greatest tasting ever. The best we have here. I acquiesced and got it. Boy was that a mistake. To wait months for cheesecake and be so disappointed. It was mediocre at best. Very disappointing. My advice don&#39;t get the Ghirardelli Cherry.
Third time here and they can NEVER get the steak right! How hard is it to cook a medium well steak! Then the manager he says oh well at least you have your Mac and cheese to enjoy for now...
Very busy location, extensive menu, very noisy inside. Good food/drink in a not so relaxing atmosphere.

Alyssa is the best server/hostess. Her hospitality is top notch and she is fast. Consistency is her key and she is all around an amazing hostess. Request her. The food was delicious of rut being my first time. Will most definitely be back here very soon. She is so good!
Hey Sandra, the Bartender...<br><br>Please don&#39;t argue with the customer. YOU ARE in the wrong...

Typical cheesecake factory.  Everyone should know whay they have by now and this one is no different. They get VERY crowded at peak times, so keep that in mind.  The fried macaroni and cheese is our favorite.

Unbelievably slow. Went there for a late lunch, they were not busy (we were seated in 8 minutes) but took 20 min to get our order and another 45 min for food. Thus over an hour from sitting to getting food. I understand sometimes this is the kitchen and not the server, but we sat there the entire time, she never checked. She mocked a member of our party, who had asked very nicely if maranara sauce could be on the side because she saw her eating a tomato later...and has never been taught how to hold a hot plate without sticking her thumb in your food. Food was poor as well. Chewy fries, their &#34;California Cheesesteak&#34; sandwich is apparently 3 flakes of meat between two hockey pucks that were supposed to be bread. Their other location on the Kansas side is night and day compared to this one. The only good thing I can say was that we didn&#39;t have any cheesecake this time so they weren&#39;t able to ruin that for us.

I enjoy the pasta dishes at Cheesecake Factory and of course, the cheesecakes, but waiting around for an hour was a cluster due to the absent mind individual that was the host. <br><br>Our buzzer gave us the indication that they were ready for us after 20 minutes, we gave it to them, the host took it and looked lost as to why we were standing there. We were waiting for our ticket for proof that we are able to be sat soon. He accused us of not giving him the buzzer at all. So strange as we were standing in front of him the entire time. I understand that it was a hectic Saturday night, but he could at least apologize and let us know that he will do what he can instead of such accusations. <br><br>The manager came and spoke with us and apologized. He stated that it&#39;ll be another 30 minutes. We waited around and after checking up on the host 2 more times, he finally said he got us a table after 40 minutes. Total wait time was about an hour and a half. <br><br>It was a busy night with high school homecoming so we gave them some slack and was happy with the service that we received from the wait staff.<br><br>Food is always consistent and delicious! <br><br>Thanks to our waiter for bringing up the mood! He was great!

I usually don&#39;t leave negative reviews, but this place sucks. My most recent experience involved them cancelling my to-go order for no reason and they did not notify me until I checked my delivery app. I ordered within their open hours and didn&#39;t order anything overly complicated. I guess they just didn&#39;t feel like cooking food and being paid for it. No idea why I would have expected that from, you know, a restaurant. The food is also overpriced and kind of bland, honestly. I just wanted some cheesecake. I&#39;ll order from somewhere else next time.

The food is over cooked and over priced.  All our meals were way over cooked.  The salmon was burnt.  The meatball in the spaghetti was dry.  No mashed potatoes on one of their busiest days of the year.  The pasta was over cooked. The cheese on top of the pasta was microwaved to a point that it was rock hard.   It was the nastiest food I&#39;ve ever tried in my life.  Bathroom was nasty. Toilets were full of urine to a point they were almost over flowing and they wouldn&#39;t flush.  When I told the manager about the condition of the bathroom I was told, &#34;They aren&#39;t that bad&#34;.   The elevator is broken.  It doesn&#39;t go to the proper floor.  We had to hit the Level 1 button several times for it to finally let us off on Level 1.

Jessica was our waitress and she was incredible. All of our food was delicious and the portions were huge. Place was packed and didn&#39;t take reservations and the wait was long but the great service made up for it.

I have always loved Cheesecake Factory but my visit on july 4th was disappointing. We had to wait 10 minutes for a table. Whwn we were seated, there were several empty tables, it was myself and my husband. They took forever bringing ulour drinks, appetizer and food. Food was excellent!

The Cheesecake Factory is decently priced and a great place to go for dinner while on The Country Club Plaza. The ambience is calming, as the lights are usually dim during dinner time. The food is flavorful, and I recommend the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. They offer a large variety of creamy cheesecakes.

So a friend stopped to get something to go. I ordered the mushrooms. They didn&#39;t look anything like the picture on the online menu. They were the tiniest mushrooms I have ever seen. But props to the person who actually stuffed them. Had to be a lot of work stuffing those. Will not order again!

This place can be hit or miss. I have eaten here roughly 3 times. Twice take out once dinning in. This last time I ate at the bar and had a drink. I ordered the shrimp tacos and a couple of margaritas. They were good the drinks were ok. I have 2 major problems with places like this. When your drinks are $12 they should pack a punch. After 2 I was sure I would be feeling good. Nope nothing. The tacos were 4 small sized soft tacos with one piece of fish cabbage and a chipotle sauce. Rice and black beans. The beans were great rice bland and horrible. Tacos had a unique flavor with the slaw. $16. Places like this take regular meals that are normal $10-12 and jack them up and served iced up drinks. I only give into this place if I haven&#39;t eaten all day and don&#39;t know what I want but want options. The cheese cake itself I could careless about. <br><br>The times I have ordered takeout I have been asked if I want bread but get none after saying I do. So I have given up on that and didn&#39;t need it so not to mad. I only eat fish so I order the salmon the first time my potatoes were a tad salty on the second visit my green beans were burnt. Like I said for the price the food should have better quality. $20 meals but they can&#39;t cook sides properly is displeasing.
