Food was good and well seasoned but a bit over priced for the small portions they serve. My waitress didnt offer any bread not that I need it. I asked her if she could bring my child&#39;s beverage with her meal so sh wouldn&#39;t fill up on juice and she brings it before the meal anyway.... But I enjoyed the outside seating on that beautiful day.
I like the Cheesecake Factory a lot they got great food &amp; amazing cheesecake . But it can do better , like have lower prices and WiFi plus Apple Pay . But pretty cool place.

Very disappointed. 1st- we sat down the silverware had dried food all over it!! It took over an hour to get our food. The waitress brought our food and half of it went on the table and my daughters lap. She took my husbands coffee literally out of his hand at the same time asking if he needed a refill.. have to say.. unfortunately we won&#39;t be returning.

Went here last night after a few other places failed. Yes, we are out of town and ate at a restaurant we have in our hometown. But this meal was amazing!  we had the orange chicken and chicken bellagio. Both were fantastic!! We had the ultimate margarita and a Long Island to drink, although pricey, they too, were amazing. We will definitely go back!

Having dinner at CFactory should be an amazing experience, we all agree! ....well tonight was not the experience expected; either with Food or Service that we received...<br><br>Started with a phone in order....after being left on hold for 7 mins we decided to call into another line, of course it was answered....took our order. Started a little bumpy....should have been our first sign to go a different direction. But we wanted CF so bad.....<br><br>Arrived, My wife went into the Restaurant ( while I waited in the car)....15mins later (which is @10-15 mins after we were told our dinner would be ready for pickup) my wife returns to the car not so happy...she was apparently told to wait in the &#34;need a table line&#34; for a pickup order , while our dinner sit at the counter getting cold.<br><br>5 mins later we arrive back to our Hotel ( CCPlaza)....and noticed that our $65.00 dinner was a mess ( picture included) ...it was cold...and NO cheesecake in the bag! Yep - the signature item was left out of the bag and yes we were charged the $8....<br><br>So we called again ( third time now) - spoke with Manager ( Nick), explained the incredible experience that began about an hour and 25 mins ago....and was told to return and we could have our $8 cheesecake, we of course we could we paid for it...<br><br>...after I reiterated that our dinner was an upside mess and cold he agreed to remake the $65 order( seemed obvious to me that would be a given ....was I suppose to be grateful? Thought I was the customer....guess not! <br><br>Confused...why would I make a second trip and hour and 30-45 mins from our first phone call to finally get my food (and pay the full ticket)...surely he would make the right call ( customer first)...not quite...after I stressed my continued unhappiness Nick said he would comp a slice of cheesecake...so now we&#39;re making progress - I expected the entire dinner to be com&#39;d ( seriously two trips/ three phone calls -nearly 2hrs from my first phone call- is this too much to expect?!?). Manager Nick disagreed....slice of Cheesecake and nothing else...true story!<br>Well my wife and I decided to eat the cold food, let the Manager take the additional profit from charging us and not giving us anything and next time eat elsewhere....<br><br>What did the customer do wrong?<br>Doesn&#39;t a manager have the authority to remedy a horrible customer experience?? <br>I<br>Additionally, is CFactory leadership comfortable with an experience ending this way?  Why are loyal customers being treated like this...are profit margins at corporate stores so tight that the  customer pays more and gets less...another reason why we love eating &#34;local&#34; owned/operated...better quality food and certainly better customer service!

The Cheesecake Factory is never a disappointment. I have always enjoyed whatever I choose off the menu. Today I decided to go with the greek salad small plate. It was filled with chunks of miniature cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese and olives. I loved it!

Something for everyone on the menu. Cheesecake Factory has probably the largest menu of any restaurant I have ever been to. <br><br>All the foods are prepared and presented professionally. All the foods taste fantastic. Highly recommend the BBQ Salmon, which is one of my favorites. <br><br>And of course you can&#39;t go there without ordering dessert. Having over 30 different cheesecakes makes this the hardest choice of the night for you. Recommend the Oreo Extreme Dream Cheesecake. Oreos cooked into the cheesecake?  Yes please.

Came here (a part of 4) for lunch. The experience is consistent with my prior experience here.<br>Food - 5<br>To start with the best, the food here is pretty good. I&#39;ve only been here twice, but on both occasions me and my companions have enjoyed the food here. Portions are large and dishes are tasty. They have a tremendous variety so it&#39;s good for those that don&#39;t know what they want or if you have many different tastes in the party. However, the menu can also be overwhelming. Cheesecakes are super tasty. Drinks are good as well. I do hate that they don&#39;t put prices on both. <br><br>Service - 3<br>Again, both times i have been disappointed with the service. They don&#39;t take reservations so you will usually wait if you come on a busy day. Our wait wasn&#39;t long (2-5) minutes, but expect up to 60 minute wait during very busy evenings. The service is very slow (probably the kitchen and not the servers themselves). No  matter, we waited for our food for way too long. Each time the servers apologized, but that doesn&#39;t do much and seems like a common occurrence. The servers are friendly despite being very busy.  <br><br>Atmosphere - 4<br>The decor is all over the place, but it isn&#39;t bad, it just doesn&#39;t have a very uniform theme. Outside (when it&#39;s not hot) the setting is really nice, next to the fountains.<br><br>Value/Price - 3.5<br>While the food is tasty and portions are great the service is negative due to long waits and propensity to get things wrong. The atmosphere is relatively neutral. Prices are above my expectations, but not totally out whack with the area. I hate that they don&#39;t put prices on cheesecakes and drinks. Drinks range at around $12. Overall, i would recommend to attend, but aim for the least busy time and know that the place is priced slightly above average.
Friday morning came here to buy a cheesecake. There many worker here but it look like they are busy talking to each other and then doing there job.

Very big menu , but you can&#39;t go wrong! This is one of those restaurants that you&#39;ll have to keep trying a new dish , but once you find your favorite dish you&#39;ll fall in love with this restaurant
Great food at a great value. They have a very extensive menu, there is sure to be something for everyone!  I had the pit beef dip sandwich, and tried the veggie melt, both were outstanding.

I&#39;ve purchased 2 cheesecakes to go this morning and when I came home, I checked my bags and found 2 pretty small slices compared to the big ones I&#39;ve always gotten. It is pretty outrageous to receive such small amount after I ended up spending $17.  I&#39;ve also ordered another time a sandwich getting no butter,. Will no go there anymore. Been going to the Cheesecake Factory for years. Extremely disappointed!

Michelle is the epitome of low class. She is a classic example of a person with zero people skills.  Never in my life will I look at cheesecake the same again without thinking about this experience.  I never plan on going that Applebee&#39;s like restaurant ever again. Brio kona mccormicks jack stack or any other restaurant on the plaza would love the added business.  I&#39;m just mad at myself that I wanted a slice of frozen cheese cake that&#39;s not even made in house<br><br>816-977-7737 if you want to ask me about my experience over the phone.  Disrespect is not something I will tolerate. <br><br>Mazin Jabr-

Once upon a time there lived a girl who resided in Wichita, Kansas. From the time she was just a wee lil&#39; sprout until those awkward teenage years, her parents would cart her to the shopping/food mecca 150 minutes away known as Kansas City - which she would later refer to as KCK thanks to high school debate.<br><br>What started out as trips to Laura Ashley where she and her mother would walk out in floral jumpsuits, and that little German sweets shop, where she and her father would walk out with chocolate smears on their faces, evolved into more hip outings. She would drag her parents to Abercrombie and insist on eating at that looming restaurant on the corner.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory became her favorite restaurant - it&#39;s uniqueness unbeknownst to Wichita, and having only visited one other time in Chicago, the demanding 16 year old would insist on ordering multiple baskets of brown, gooey, oaty bread - warm and fresh from the oven.<br><br>She would scarf down avocado egg rolls - damning the abmoniation that those surely are against her Asian background - sparing not the even the puffy rice noodles adorning the plate. Soft, warm and creamy avocado filling be-speckled with peppers wrapped in delicate, golden brown fried wonton wrappers - surely these were health food that would not disrupt her teenage diet.<br><br>And to cap off a meal, she would indulge - depending on the season - in either a chocolate peanut butter cookie dough cheesecake (which she now bemoans the loss of and didn&#39;t/still doesn&#39;t give a hoot about the inevitable hives that would accompany that luscious histamine inducing dessert) or her favorite dessert of all time: the White Chocolate Peppermint Bark cheesecake that would debut only in the holiday season. <br><br>Not much has changed: instead of engorging in all 8 half eggrolls solo, she now shares these with her kinfolk - ordering, instead, some raw tuna piled atop avocado and served with four delicately fried wonton chips (Ahi Tartare). But somehow she manages to lick clean the luscious mashed potatoes adorning her father&#39;s plate and the sweet potato fries served with her aunt&#39;s beautiful burger. These, she declares, are sweet potato fry perfection. Chain restaurants have the advantage of millions of tasters, and thanks to that, those fries rule...when dipped in honey mustard dressing.<br><br>And once a year, she insists...ABSOLUTELY DEMANDS that she get her White Chocolate Peppermint Bark cheesecake, a red peppermint dotted cake with a white chocolate topping that sits upon a dense brownie bottom...and please, serve this with hot fudge.

The food gained this place an easy 4 stars but the service knocked it down a bit.<br><br>Cheesecake Factories are always a reliable good time. This trip, though, was bizarre. The guy working the host counter was a bit creepy and gave off a pedo vibe. Unkempt and stared at everyone.<br>Our waitress was pleasant but not very smart. Her timing was also incredibly off. She interpreted &#34;give me a minute to look at the menu&#34; as &#34;neglect us for 20 minutes without even bringing the drinks already ordered.&#34;<br>When the food was finally delivered by someone else, our server decided to come up from right behind the other server before we even took a bite and ask &#34;how is everything tasting?&#34; Can we have ten seconds? <br>Leftovers were stuffed into a tiny box which leaked all over by the time we got home. She got us two pieces of cheesecakes to go in two separate small containers... now we have three separate (tiny) boxes in three separate smaller plastic bags. Apparently, it would take too long for her to get a bigger bag to consolidate everything, so we walked up to the cheesecake counter ourselves and got a large bag within two seconds.<br>Great food experience spoiled by poor hiring decisions and, perhaps, inadequate employee development.<br>Your experience may vary. Cheers!

What can I say that hasn&#39;t already been said? Nothing. That&#39;s because that&#39;s really the impression that I get here. Everything that is here has been done before. There is nothing that just catches my eye and says pick me, Kim. That&#39;s sad to me.<br>It was a 50 min wait on a Thursday which hey, I&#39;m okay with as long as I will be dazzled. I&#39;m easily dazzled. I&#39;ve been dazzled by shiny buttons but back to the subject at hand.<br>The seating is discouraging. We were a group of six adults and we were sat in a booth that would have been uncomfortable for me and my four teens. That&#39;s standard for them according to their manager though. He apologized profusely.<br>So I picked the chicken Parmesan sandwich and can say, yep it&#39;s a sandwich. I wasn&#39;t wowed but I wasn&#39;t upset. I was overwhelmingly underwhelmed. I ended up bringing it home. I don&#39;t know what&#39;s the deal with the current trend of big bread on sandwiches but I don&#39;t like it. The flavors were meh. I will say I&#39;m glad that I got the chicken parm since two people at the table opted to not even take their leftovers since they were disappointed.<br>I will say that they are generous with their portions. Also, I truly did enjoy the raspberry lemonade. It was the shining star of my meal. I couldn&#39;t get enough of it. I hate that this restaurant makes me feel like a food snob because I&#39;ve found joy in $1 tacos. This just doesn&#39;t do it for me.

Not bad for a chain! I&#39;ve always had good service. It&#39;s great to come here for a couple small plates. I love the (not so) little house salad! The crab cakes and crab bites are also very good. For dessert I ALWAYS get the Tiramisu cheesecake, is the absolute BOMB. Try it!

Always great food, always great service.<br><br>Mostly we go here for appetizers and drinks. Because they are delicious. I was just now listing all of the ones I love but it was ridiculous so I&#39;m instead going to merely highlight the Crispy Cuban thingies and the Firecracker Salmon.<br><br>I don&#39;t even try to remember which cocktails of theirs I&#39;ve gotten before, haven&#39;t had a bad one yet, so I just choose the ones that appeal to me most that day.<br><br>If you go during busy times SHOCK it&#39;s going to be busy. So we like to go during the less busy times so we can enjoy ourselves at our leisure without feeling bad.<br><br>Bartender guy is awesome, and of course the waitstaff is all quite good.
Try their Oreo Cheese cake and their New Orleans Cajun Dish. Both are very good! Also, the coffee is fantastic! <br><br>Sincerely,<br>Jonathan Fayard

Get something new every time I go and this is the first time I could&#39;ve done without the meal chosen. Matter of personal taste and confident it was not the fault of theirs at all. As always the Cheesecake is perfect. Great location and friendly service.

The male host as you walk in is funny and greets everyone as soon as you walk in. We ate at the bar and it was entertaining watching him make people laugh...he&#39;s a character. <br>Everyone knows the portions are huge so we ordered appetizers for lunch. Had my favs: Thai Chicken Wrap, Spinach &amp; Artichoke Dip and Strawberry Shortcake. Just the right amount for 2 hungry people without feeling overly stuffed. <br>Whitney was the bartender as we sat at the bar. She is friendly, service-oriented and attentive. She took care of our needs before we even asked. We&#39;ll be back!!!

The wait was over an hr, then they stuck 6 women with coats and purses in a tiny booth, then said we could wait another hr for a larger table, then manager was not helpful, kept giving excuses that did not make the experience any better. I told him to go away, he huffed off and said fine. Really, so much for our first annual Christmas Party! We decided to stay, hell been here all night anyway! Will see about the food. Our server Holly, very apologetic, better manners!

So we love the Cheesecake Factory but this trip was just so so. Went at lunch they were not busy yet but service slow. They took away the shrimp bacon sandwich that I am so bummed about. Key lime cheesecake AMAZING!!

Let me tell you this location of the Cheesecake Factory has great service!<br>I believe that service can make or break a business. <br>Well this location had no problems with serving our party of 10. Even after having our waitress come back several time to take our orders &amp; continues to have later people needing to be added to our tables the waitress didn&#39;t miss a beat. <br>I can really appreciate how well organized &amp; knowledgeable of the menu she was. There were several people who asked for her opinion on what to get &amp; they we all happy with their selections. I ordered the crab cake balls &amp; they came out excellent.  They were served with a lemon sauce &amp; I didn&#39;t know how that would taste with them but the waitress assured me that they were good. When is got the balls they were crunchy on the outside &amp; moist on the inside. The flavor was well seasoned but had a little bit too much breading for my liking but I still ate them! Lol <br>When it was time to pay the waitress only took a few a<br>Credit cards &amp; bills at a time. I really appreciate that so that she doesn&#39;t get mixed up &amp; mess up someone&#39;s charges. It takes great waitress to know what your limitations are &amp; to work within them. I would rather wait a extra few minutes to be charged correctly then to get done faster now &amp; have to fight about the wrong charges later.

Got seated pretty quickly.  Waitress started with us and was pleasant while getting getting our waters.  &#34;Michael&#34; came, appearing slightly annoyed, and informed us that he was going to serve us.  Appetizers cake out and they were excellent.  Our entrees took quite a while and once received, the plates almost burnt our hands.  Michael blamed my son&#39;s pizza for the delay.  Took another 5 minutes for the pizza and it was hard on one side and soggy on the other.  My other son&#39;s burger bun was soaked through.  Asked for two cheesecakes to go and Michael brought them out on plates.  Very annoyed that he had to box them up.  First time in years that I left no tip.  Makes me uncomfortable, but when some of the food was ok and the service was extremely disappointing, I feel like I did the right thing.

Just finished eating. 1st off we did not get any bread until just before 2 of our party received their food. The rest of us waited and waited then low and behold my sons order and my order arrived after the 1st two had only a bite or two left. The waitress said someone should have brought it out. Ya think? My side dish was room temperature. Poor experience. This was only my second visit here. I feel the food and service is far from what one would expect from the price you pay in this part of town.

The Chicken Madeira &amp; Steak Diane combination is a great dish. Both have unique, fantastic flavor and for only 21.95 it&#39;s a great price. Topping it off with any of their signature cheesecake makes the meal complete.

Wow. Very disappointing. I ordered the filet and it had a huge tendon through it. They did replace but took over thirty minutes so I got it to go. We have been here over 90 minutes and asked for bread repeatedly and they didn&#39;t have any.   To top it off- no toilet paper in the ladies room. I&#39;ve gone to many Cheesecake Factories across the US, but this one was a mess!
Went here for a to go order. Specifically asked for bread and butter. Bread and butter didn&#39;t come with. The staff was rude as well. The CF in Overland Park is much better.

Say no!!! Today I waited over 30 minutes for my food, my utensils were dirty with old salad pieces and my burrito had at least two pieces of hair in it! I spoke with the general manager name Jackie and she was extremely rude. She didn&#39;t seem to care that my lunch date with my sons was ruined and I had to literally beg her to offer more compensation other than a slice of cheesecake! Don&#39;t waste your money or energy here.

We hadn&#39;t been here in a while so decided to check it out again for lunch.  I noticed they now have small plates, quite a variety too.  We ordered the Vietnamese Tacos off of that menu and then our regular orders of Shrimp Bistro (my fave) and burgers for the boys.  The tacos were very tasty, but could have had a higher quality of pork in them.  There were so many other flavors going on with it that the stringy, overcooked pork really didn&#39;t detract from it too much.  The Shrimp Bistro was excellent, as always.  I don&#39;t know how, but they seem to have the freshest tasting shrimp in that dish.  For the price, next time we are going to order several small plates and see how that goes.<br><br>I do not eat the cheesecake here.  I guess I&#39;m a cheesecake snob, but for a place to have it in their name you&#39;d think it would be better than it is.  I have been spoiled by Eli&#39;s in Chicago, Claim Jumper&#39;s out west, and of course, my own.

The service is impeccable, but you can comparable food at most other places cheaper.<br><br>On my last visit, I had ordered a pizza. The crust on half of the pizza was as black as can be, but they still brought it out. Due to time constraints, I didn&#39;t send it back. <br><br>The Peach Bellini here is very delicious.

I called ahead of time to advise I will have a party of up to 15. The lady I started talking to did not allow me to finish and cut me off with an abrupt &#34;We don&#39;t do reservations&#34;. I advised that it&#39;s not my concern, I told her she was rude and turned to speak with Jenny who was friendly and helpful. We had a few ladies trickle in late and we felt pressure about one of our tables, the manager came and started clearing the table and scooting it from us. We advised we still need the table and he stated &#34;We thought you were consolidating&#34;. He was not happy and it was visible. I do not suggest a big party eat here.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! The sad thing is, my wife really enjoys their cheesecake...but we can&#39;t stand bad service! A group of friends and I decided to go here to celebrate my birthday, this past weekend, which was a bad idea. Lousy waitress (didn&#39;t receive drinks for at least 30 minutes after being seated), Delayed food, and worst of them all....poor customer service!!

Great restaurant.<br>Bangbang chicken my favorite one.<br>The bread was wonderful and I had the carbonara. Hubby had the pizza. Loved the cheesecake and our server was excellent! They know how to treat their customers!!

I used to really enjoy The Cheesecake Factory but they have become so focused on creating profit that they have taken away from a great experience.  Tables are too close to each other to the point that it&#39;s awkward and uncomfortable.  At the 2-top tables you might as well be sitting with the people to your left and right.<br><br>Then there&#39;s the price.  We ordered 2 sandwiches and shared a dessert and the bill was $40.   The meal and the experience were certainly not worth that.  The service was timely and friendly but the sandwiches were not hot.  Perhaps they sat in the queue waiting to be served for a bit.  It will probably be a long time before I&#39;m back to give them another chance.  There are just too many other places that are better across the board.

I eat here all the time!! It has a great happy hour with happy hour drinks and apps! The waiters are always great and attentive. My favorite is Adam at the bar downstairs! He is great!! The managers are always nice as well. They help out their staff and everyone seems to enjoy their job! <br><br>The menu is extensive. You will always find something you like here! And they have a great cocktail list!

The food was pretty good, the atmosphere was nice, but the real winner here was Kristin. She was smokin hot and acted as an A1 wingman for my friend. You a real one Kristin. You a real one. She deserves a raise

I completely love this place. Their food is delicious and they don&#39;t call it the Cheesecake Factory for nothing. I love the variety in desserts and drinks. I have yet to have a bad experience here.

Of course the food is always fantastic, (I&#39;d highly recommend the chicken and biscuits if you&#39;re looking for a delicious comfort food). But I brought my sister here for her bachelorette party as her first Cheesecake Factory experience, and our server made the night unforgettable. Jared B. was attentive, knowledgeable of the menu, and had the best personality that kept us laughing all night! Thank you for the incredible ending to our night!

They are always super busy at this location. Even if you want just cheesecake at 10 pm on a Saturday night it&#39;s still a wait. They do have the bake case right by the entry though so if you&#39;re there for just dessert you can easily get it to go and eat it on a bench on the plaza.

If your main objective for lunch with a sister is an enormous menu of choices and decent service in a dynamic atmosphere, then The Cheesecake Factory will fulfil your needs.  I have not had a bad experience there, the food is always tasty and it is certainly plentiful.  But, considering they have been on the Plaza for quite a number of years and I have been a customer only 3 or 4 times, it isn&#39;t exactly what I am seeking very often.<br><br>Lunch on Monday was Sis&#39; treat and so the choice was hers.  I had a very good and extremely filling selection from the SKINNYLICIOUS® menu.  I chose the Chicken Salad Sandwich with a side salad dressed with Balsamic dressing.  The greens were plentiful and a nice Spring mix with absolutely no iceberg in sight.  The housemade chicken salad included Roasted Almonds, Lettuce, Tomato and Mayonnaise and was served on Toasted Brioche Bread that really made the sandwich something special.  Sis also ordered from the Skinnylicious menu and got a Hamburger on a Toasted Bun with Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Pickles and Mayonnaise which is also served with a Green Salad.  Neither of us had room for dessert, which was disappointing, as luscious looking cheesecake slices as well as other goodies kept whizzing by our table for delivery to all our dining neighbors (who had planned their eating and drinking more judiciously -- or else they just waddled out of the restaurant, I&#39;m not sure which). <br><br>We arrived at about 1:15 and after a five minute wait were seated.  To correspond with my recollections of past visits, the noise level made it difficult to carry on conversation and I remembered why I tend to avoid the experience.  But the service was very efficient and the food was quite good, so I balanced the pros and cons to a solid 3-star rating.  The Cheesecake Factory is never going to be a favorite for me, but it is obviously a winner with hundreds of customers every single day, so they must be doing something &#34;Right&#34;.  And maybe I&#39;ll make another visit in about five years and remember to &#34;Save room for some Cheesecake&#34; when I go. PS: Thanks again for lunch, Sis.

I want to acknowledge Brett, the manager who so kindly took care of me during my entree moment of distress, he was very polite and pleasant to encounter.  I first ordered the Bang-Bang Chicken and Shrimp, not expecting the taste to be so sweet, I am used to spicier thai type food. I called Brent and explained my distress, without any hassle, he asked me which entree would I like to replace my order with. I ordered my usual the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo, one of the best dishes on the menu.  I also ordered the cuban sandwich with fries for my hubby, it was a very delicious experience, and his first experience trying it at The Cheesecake Factory.   My husband is picky when it comes to cuban sandwiches and he found the cuban sandwich from The Cheesecake Factory to be the one of best cuban sandwiches.  He would order it again.

Always delicious! My favorite entree is the orange chicken. It&#39;s well spiced and huge portion. The typhoon punch is $10 but also with the splurge. There seems to always be a wait, I always check the bar upstairs and downstairs for a seat or two and usually get right in.

I know a lot of people love to hate big chains like The Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;m not one of those people.  I&#39;ve been to this location a half-dozen times over the years and have never had a bad experience.  It&#39;s usually very busy but the wait has never been as long (in my experience) as their estimate.  On my most recent visit, I wasn&#39;t super hungry so I chose the Vietnamese tacos from their small plates menu; it was less than six dollars for one of the best meals I&#39;ve had all YEAR, folks.  Truly phenomenal.  I split a piece of chocolate something-or-other cheesecake with two other ladies and we still did not finish it all.  It was great, but a little too rich and the portion was ridiculously large.

Great service! Wanted to sit outside and had to wait 15-20 mins even though there were several open tables outside but we understand sometimes we have to wait. Our server Cory do an amazing job! He was on top of our orders, gave us great recommendations on the food, and was constantly stopping by to make sure we were going fine. AMAZING JOB by Cory!
Such a surprise to know that my husband can read minds and bring home an entire strawberry cheesecake from The Cheesecake Factory. So delish!!

Just a warning dont ever order to-go from this restaurant. I should have quit while I was ahead and hung up after being put on hold for nearly 10 minutes. When I arrived to the restaurant i waited 5-10 minutes to be acknowledged after their delivery partner cut in front of me to get her take out order. Not their fault, but nonetheless irritating. When I finally am acknowledged she needs to go to the kitchen to check on the order. She comes back, has me pay, and says it would be another 5 minutes. She runs my card and still no sign of my food; I asked if I was early since this was 15 minutes past my pick up time with the line debacle. She said no something happened with my order but it would be out soon. Fast forward 20 minutes later I&#39;m still waiting and she offered complementary cheesecake for the wait but all I wanted was what i ordered. Almost 30 minutes in and still no sign of the food. Since I already paid I continued to wait growing more frustrated as time passed. Finally she says they&#39;re boxing up my order after 45 minutes of waiting for a carryout order. I will never order from this restaurant again and can&#39;t believe I paid full price to waste an hour of my night. The cashier was nice and apologetic but the sitution was absurd. I wont be returning.

The Cheesecake Factory is open year around, but I want to begin my synopsis with a holiday time recommendation.  During the holidays when the Plaza lights are on, ask for a seat on the second level by the windows.  Your wait might be a little longer than if you regularly had to wait, but you will enjoy a fantastic view of the Plaza Lights while you enjoy your dinner or your dessert.<br><br>Okay, now for main review.  Most of the menu features sandwiches, burgers, small pizzas and comfort foods.  None of the dishes are particularly mind blowing, but they are solid meals served in large portions.  You might want to ask for a to-go box.  I particularly like the artichoke and crab dip.<br><br>After you&#39;ve boxed up your leftovers please make sure to leave room for dessert.  The cheesecake is amazing.  It comes in plenty of flavors and my favorite is the pineapple upside down concoction.<br><br>The service is pretty good, but I will say things will slow down during times when the restaurant is at its peak rush.  The restaurant will become busy and there is usually a wait, but luckily there is a nice patio where you can wait until a table opens up.<br><br> If you&#39;re out and about and looking for dinner or dessert on the Plaza, this is a good place to start.

Our food was excellent today for lunch. The service was great. Want to give a special hand to our waiter, Corey R. He has been the best waiter by far at any restaurant in a long time. Attentive, anticipated what we wanted before we asked, genuine. Made lunch so enjoyable. He&#39;s a keeper. We had two kids with us and he took the effort to engage them. Everyone of the wait staff were on their game today!

I went with my co workers tonight and I got the spicy skinny chicken tacos.  So good! Plenty of food too! I would normally not order off the &#34;light&#34; menu, but I am SO glad that I did! My co workers also enjoyed their meals and no one left hungry! I also got the salted caramel cheesecake to go and it was the bomb! All the ingredients were fresh as well!

CHEESECAKE!!!<br><br>That&#39;s why I come here because the food is just ok. So I decided to get the Reese&#39;s cheesecake because I was in the mood for some peanut butter and it was just peanut butter overload! It was too heavy and rich for me and I should have just stuck to my fave, the Red Velvet cheesecake that is encrusted in white chocolate shavings. There cheesecakes are usually very light, but this Reese&#39;s one was just too much! We sat outside since it was a nice day out which I&#39;m really glad we had this option in the Plaza. I wish more Cheesecake Factorys would do this! <br><br>Pros:<br>-CHEESECAKE=YUMMY!!!<br><br>Cons:<br>-none really....I just don&#39;t think the food is that spectacular here so oI only come for the cheesecake<br><br>Why I gave it a 3......<br>Come for the cheesecake and leave the food behind! Seriously people, the food is something I could make but that cheesecake is like a little slice of heaven because it is very light and rich at the same time. Definitely will be back for the cheesecake!

well whats not to love about the cheesecake factory.  pretty good food at a decent price.  My only complaint was the server completely forgot to put our kids order in.  so we all got our food and then had to wait for our kids hot dog to come out.

So, confession.  In a past life, before I became absolutely obsessed with food, I went to chain restaurants like Red Lobster or Olive Garden and...Cheescake Factory.  But I definitely considered Cheesecake the top of the heap.  And here&#39;s why:<br><br>1.  I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake in 5 states and there was a consistent high standard of service and food at all five.<br>2.  Great selection of dishes of all kinds of varieties.<br>3.  Really reasonable prices.<br>4.  Huge portions.<br><br>Have been here with friends for drinks a couple times and had - of course  - the amazing cheesecake.  This location is scenic and always busy.

This place is great regardless of what city I&#39;m in. Everything from the orange chicken to the seafood gumbo is fantastic. My family loves the food here. 4 different cheesecake slices today and none of them disappointed.

Sara and I were down on the plaza, and contemplating dinner. I had never been to the Cheesecake Factory, (yes, me, I HAVE never been to the famous Cheesecake factory till now) so we decided cheesecake for dinner. There was no line, we walked in, and were waited on immediately. Fantastic service. <br><br>The bathrooms are up a spiral staircase. There are gorgeous columns of stone in the dining area. The dining area has both tables, and also booth tables. There is a cake rack with most of the cheesecakes near the cash register. We were handed the menus,and the happy hour menu! My God, Kansas City, the happy hour drink prices were $5.00 for a mojihito, makes me think the actual drink prices are...what? Seems to be a pattern. We didn&#39;t order from the drink menu. <br><br>On the cheesecake menu, it lists over 30 types of cheesecake. It is in the back of the menu, which is a spiral bound menu of many pages. I took a while to read them all, and settled on a yummy piece of pineapple upside down cheesecake. I wasn&#39;t sure of the price...uh, they could add the price to the menu, it&#39;d be kind of kind. Some of the prices are $6.95, some are 7.95. Sometimes that might make a difference,and the individual prices aren&#39;t on the menu. My cheesecake rocked my world. It really was good. <br><br>Other than the little things, I can think of 30 reasons to go back to the Cheesecake Factory. Is it worth a huge line? I&#39;m not sure. I&#39;d not go there when there&#39;s a huge line, but that&#39;s just me.I don&#39;t wait in line in Kansas City, I go to the next place.  It is a beautiful place to eat, with outside eating, a bar with over priced beverages, and wonderful cheesecake.
Service was great and cheesecake was amazing as usual! My only complaint is that I ordered the four-cheese pasta and there was almost no cheese on it. It did not taste very good and was overpriced.

Delicious, reasonably priced, and always busy! We typically come here for cheesecake alone but we went for the full meal this time. <br>Arriving at 9:00 on a Saturday night we were put on a thirty minute wait. Once sat we were promptly greeted by our server who was good, no real complaints with him.<br>Food was okay, margaritas were okay and expensive for the quality we got. <br>This review only get four starts because of one little issue that arised. I had ordered the pasta dish, meat on the side. Once our food arrived the chicken was in the dish and I had it sent back. By time it came back, my boyfriend was finished with his meal and it had already been boxed up. Although the manager did deliver my meal there was no further action taken. It kind of dampered the entire meal and we weren&#39;t compensated in any way. Finishing with the usual cheesecake we were out of there two hours later full and content. <br>Next time were just going to do cheesecake and go elsewhere for dinner like normal.
I am really sad that they no longer offer Thai chicken pasta. It was always my go to dish.

I have yet to come into the Cheesecake Factory and actually eat dinner -- My husband and I swung by to pick up a couple slices of cheesecake to go one night.  Unfortunately, we had to rough it and stand in the to-go line for well over 30 minutes just for those two pieces of cheesecake but lemme tell ya.. It was worth it! I can&#39;t wait to go back and have another slice of the banana creme cheesecake!! :)

It was soooo good. Had dinner last night with my friend, it was about 10:30 when we got there, the service still excellent and they didn&#39;t rush us until we finish our meal after 11:10. Ordered mango lime cheesecake as desert at the end, even I was so full, can&#39;t help to finish it all.

I&#39;ve been to a bunch of Cheesecake Factories in various states: NY, NJ, GA... and then I come here and i&#39;m like &#34;Meh?&#34; <br><br>Arrival and Ambience: <br><br>Like every other CF, this location is beautifully maintained. Impeccably clean, even on a rainy night. We went on a Friday evening and got immediate service. We sat at a booth by the window. <br><br>Service: <br><br>Waitress seemed really &#39;green&#39;. Wasn&#39;t sure if she was new or having an off day. She didn&#39;t visit us regularly and forgot a few things. Cute, sweet lil girl though. <br><br>Food: <br><br>This is the stingiest portioned Cheesecake Factory in terms of bread. Every one that I usually visit gives you 3 loaves of bread, and this one only gives you 2 --- and they are so small in comparison to other locations. Were the grains on strike in the kitchen? I need answers. <br><br>I ordered the pizza... and it was large, fresh and delicious. Crust was on point. The heartburn was worth it. <br><br>Drank lemonade... tart and delicious as usual. <br><br>Got the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake. Delicious but couldn&#39;t finish it all. <br><br>I LOVED the atmosphere though. Cheesecake is always a place where you can go and kick back with your friends in an unrushed, unhurried manner and catch up. <br><br>So I would go again, and just hope the service is a little better --- thassit!

The service was horrible. The menu is huge, but everything that we had was gross. I think they would benefit from decreasing the options and perfecting the items that they keep. The side salad had virtually no dressing and was only a bed of lettuce. The remainder of the food tasted like a frozen meal that was warmed up. The bread we received was as hard a rock. We will not go back.
Food was fantastic- Chicken Lemon Couscous, patio dining and tasty drinks made for a perfect summer evening. Cesar took great care of us and our puppy!

Wow. If I could give this 0 stars I probably would. My boyfriend and I decided to go to cheesecake the other night to celebrate his birthday before he went out of town. This will be the last time I go to this cheesecake because of this experience. I work in the industry myself and am not one to complain but this needed to be reviewed. We sat at the bar and were greeted by a super nice host! That was the last good thing of the night. My boyfriend and I have been to the cheesecake a million times and ordered one of our favorites the fried Mac and cheese balls and a couple of cocktails. After receiving our cocktails and some bread that we had to ask for he took our order and gave us our check? We hadn&#39;t even gotten our appetizer yet why print us the check? I understand it&#39;s busy but sheesh. Thankfully I did look at the receipt because I noticed that we were waiting on appetizers that were never going to come... he had forgotten to ring them which is totally fine until we realized the people who had sat down after us by almost 10 minutes were now eating... Mac and cheese balls cake and were phenomenal. I ordered the chicken Madeira and it was also great my boyfriend on the other hand ordered the Cajun jumbalaya pasta  and found hair that was most definitely not either of ours in his pasta. After notifying our waiter he said &#34;oh wow I&#39;m sorry about that&#34; did not offer to get us a new one, get us dessert, or even notify a manager... it was very apparent it bothered my boyfriend so I was thinking oh maybe he&#39;ll get out cheesecake! He even asked us what we were celebrating! We ordered cheesecake and the waiter insisted we take it to go because I said I was full? And after all of that catastrophe not one manager was notified and we paid a total of $130 for some of the worst service I have ever had hands down.

Was there yesterday evening with family and was told 1 hour wait. After 1 hour and 30 mins we were seated.We were so hungry that we all ordered right away. Food came with in 15 mins. All good so far. I ordered factory grande burrito, which came in cold. After 7 mins got hold of our waitress, she took the burrito back and said we will warm it up. After 15 mins she emerged again and said it&#39;s taking longer as they are making me a new one. Another 10 mins later same old plate emerged and burrito was hot this time but it was very dry. Marinara was sticking to plate. We go to cheesecake quite a few times but this time I was dissatisfied and disappointed

Decided to go to this restaurant for my birthday to celebrate. After looking through the menu for 20 minutes not a single server came to my table. I was not even offered water. This is terrible service and don&#39;t expect to be coming back anytime in the future when the server was more focused on holding side conversations with others.

This was the second time coming to this location and we were not disappointed either time. We went over the noon hour on a Saturday and surprisingly they were not busy at all. <br><br>The mac and cheese burger is definitely a favorite of mine. How can it not be with all that cheese! We then followed our meal with cheesecake of course. I enjoyed a piece of raspberry lemon cheesecake. <br><br>Overall it was a great experience with great food. From now on I think we will order our cheesecake first and then decide if we want something else because I left feeling miserable.  I didn&#39;t want to take a doggy bag because we were walking and definitely couldn&#39;t let it go to waste.

Poor service, overly salted potatoes,  verrryyyy fishy salmon, chicken gristle in pasta dish. Won&#39;t  return. Not the restaurant I  remember  visiting a few years back. What a disappointment  for my  son&#39;s  birthday dinner :(

Their food sounded great but I never got to find out since they don&#39;t have a parking lot to accommodate their carrying capacity.  The location of this place is ridiculous and even downright dangerous. The traffic I had to go through just to get there was enough to make any good person lose their shit quick. The outside patio area and the inside areas were standing room only. The location is like going into a protest war zone. The cheesecake factory needs to change locations. That whole plaza is a hazard. I even saw a crazy dude with a huge sign ringing a bell yelling about the end of the world outside the restaurant. There were hundreds of tourists walking around blocking traffic and being very disruptive and vulgar. Total nightmare circus. No respectable person wants to go through any of this trouble.

The wait was 1.5 hours. We opted to take the food to go and eat it elsewhere. It took 15 minutes for my food to be ready as carry out. I definitely recommend taking this route if you are craving Cheesecake factory food! I ordered the Bistro Shrimp Pasta. Its my GO-TO dish for Cheesecake factory. I love this stuff! So what if it was voted the worst food in America 2010?!?!<br><br>Cheesecake Factory&#39;s Bistro Shrimp Pasta<br>2,730 calories<br>78 g saturated fat<br>919 mg sodium<br>141 g carbohydrates<br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fhealth.yahoo.net%2Fexperts%2Featthis%2Fworst-foods-america-2010&amp;s=ed2e6e05d62dd69f96d56fea93f36f833eb53eba0ccd4b99604942825502b4c8" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">health.yahoo.net/experts…</a><br><br>Service was good and fast. Me likes!

I have no idea why I don&#39;t go here more often.  The menu is HUGE, staff is friendly, food is good to great. They ALWAYS have tables because it is seriously huge inside.<br>We went for brunch and I had the Monte Christo sandwich which was lovely.  Everyone at the table enjoyed their food and the bonus was that we were sitting out by the fountain, it was gorgeous out and Plaza Art Fair weekend so the people watching couldn&#39;t be beat!
Food was mediocre, disappointed in food.,service good, ambience good. I ordered the mango avocado salad with chicken was overcooked and dry.
Can not rate anything because everything there is awesome and best. Avocado rolls, and what so ever.
They do not take reservations even for large parties.  The yelp listing are misleading.  The food and ambiance is superlative but expect to wait.  Every.  Single.  Time.
Can&#39;t make a reservation on your birthday for a large party, so unless you want,to waste 40-60 minutes, on your birthday avoid.

After an evening at the theater we decided to have dinner at the Cheesecake Factor.  We arrived around 9:30 and things were very slow.  No one was at the hostess station and very few tables were occupied.  We asked for a table for two and we were told we would have to wait 5-10 minutes.  Really?  The hostess continued to organize things behind her station, carry on conversation with waitresses and totally ignore us for a good amount of time.  She then looked up and called out our name as if there was a crowd of 100 there when it was just the two of us.  We were taken to our table and waited almost 10 minutes to be waited on.  We finally put in our order.  We ordered Nachos as an appetizer and Spicy Cashew Chicken and a Chopped Salad.  When the Nachos came they were burnt, not just browned but actually black on the edges.  The food finally came and it was fine.  We had to almost beg for drink refills.  The Cheesecake Factory  has really raised their prices to where it&#39;s almost a fine dining experience (or should be).  It&#39;s hard to find even a simple entree for under $15 and most are more than that.  We ended up spending over $50.  Needless to say we won&#39;t be going back.  It&#39;s crazy to have to pay that much for bad service, being ignored and burnt food.  There are great places on the Plaza to dine.  I&#39;d steer clear of this one.

Cheesecake Factory has good food, enormous portions, and a menu the size of a book. I&#39;ve been to both KC locations numerous times, and my wife and I typically split an entree (usually the orange chicken). The portion sizes are such that you can get two full meals out of one entree. Maybe not the burgers, but most of the $16-20 items. The cheesecake is also delicious. I&#39;m a big fan of the pineapple upside down cheesecake. The Plaza location is a little cramped and super busy. If you&#39;d like a Friday/Saturday night cheesecake fix, I&#39;d recommend the Overland Park location. It is laid out better, and you aren&#39;t packed in like sardines while waiting for a table. My favorite time to go to the Plaza location is on a nice warm day for Sunday brunch and get a table outside.
If you&#39;re going to take part in Postmates at least follow through. Every time I&#39;ve ordered from you through them you&#39;ve dropped the ball. Unexpected for a corporate fancy Applebee&#39;s.

I have a wonderful time everytime I go..even in the summer when it&#39;s packed and you got to get a pager or blinker and wait. I do know if you go to the bar you can get in faster and order and eat. They make wonderful drinks and great white wine. I usually order appetizers the tacos and fried calamari. Daughter gets nachos son gets jambalaya my fried gets spaghetti with large shrimp. And yes cheesecake red velvet, snicker, turtle and my die hard flavor is PINEAPPLE UPSIDE DOWN. how could you not enjoy the buttery goodness of the cake and sweet pineapples with the luscious smooth cheesecake.

When in Kansas City I always try to make a stop at the Cheese Cake Factory on the Plaza. This trip was no different with the exception that Sunday brunch was the only time I had available. Expectations were high but I must say I was let down.<br><br>I arrived with my party at 11:00 and we ordered Bloody Mary&#39;s and examined the menu. There were only aout 8 other people in the restaurant but we noticed right away our server seemed distracted and was absent a great deal. She took our orders but the drinks too 15 minuets to arrive and later she brought water and some bread. We kept looking but it appeared she was busy elsewhere. <br><br>Our orders took nearly 40 minuets to arrive and the Mexican egg dish I ordered was cold and did not have much flavor. Our server never asked if we wanted another round of drinks and finally brought out our checks. Since we were a group of 6 an 18% gratuity was automatically added which did not set well with our group based on the service we had received. <br><br>Everyone in our group was disappointed. It could have just been an off day for the restaurant  crew but  overall  this was not a very satisfactory brunch. We will be back the next time we are in KC but with some apprehension.

Food (aka appetizers):<br>1) Avocado Egg Rolls:  Generous amounts of avocado, tomato, onion, with a dash of cilantro in a fried crisp wrapper.  Quite delicious and paired nicely with the tamarind-cashew dipping sauce.  <br>2) Fried Avocado, Mushrooms, and Zucchini: paired with a ranch and another slightly spicy dipping sauce.  Fried avocado was ok, but the fried zucchini was quite good<br>3) Tropical Fruit Smoothie: fresh mango, passion fruit, pineapple, and coconut blended and topped with a strawberry and pineapple slice.  Refreshing, not too thick.  <br><br>Ambiance:<br>Nice restaurant, great location near the plaza, but the service was incredibly slow.  Maybe I&#39;m comparing to quick LA style service, but it took FOREVER!  <br><br>Bottom Line:<br>A-OK.  Would probably dine elsewhere if I ever came back to KC.  Good vegetarian options, though.

I was here about a week ago and had a really tough time being satisfied when I finally walked out the door. I don&#39;t eat here often, but met some friends this week for a birthday dinner. The food was good, but the poor waiter was over-extended having several large tables at the same time. But, that wasn&#39;t why I was so disappointed. Mostly, I had a the toughest time with the host stand.<br>I had arrived first because out of my friends that were coming, I live the closest. This normally isn&#39;t a problem because I am usually just sat at our table and allowed to wait. NOT THE CASE HERE!! When I got to the front of the mass of people in the restaurant, after mentioning that there would be six of us I was promptly told that I had to wait until at least three people from our party were present before I could be put at a table. I have never heard of this before... Really? Being willing to be patient I accept their answer and took my buzzer and sat down. Well, when it became clear that my friends were running late due to traffic and an accident on the highway, I thought maybe they would make an exception and let me sit at a table. I was wrong. Not only did I get the feeling that I didn&#39;t matter to them because I was just one person, but they continued to give tables to fit the size of our party to other people and when my friends finally arrived we still had to wait an additional half hour to be seated! So a customer that got to a &#34;first come first serve type restaurant&#34; got shoved to the side and made to wait over an hour and a half before getting a table. This &#34;there must be half of your party present&#34; idea does not make for a good customer experience. Whether you are super-busy or not, EVERY customer should be made to feel important.<br>I&#39;m pretty sure the next time someone asks me to come to the Cheesecake Factory on a weekend, I am going to politely decline!

I wish i could give it 0 stars. First off our buzzer never went off so eventually i went up and they were like &#34;oh i don&#39;t know what happened&#34; so we had to wait longer to get our table. Then we ordered and our waiter got literally every single one of our orders wrong. It was just a mess. They didn&#39;t even take anything off the bill. I got a soda, pizza, and slice of cheesecake. After tip, it ended up being 30 dollars, and i tipped the minimum i could. Not worth it. terrible and over priced

My wife and I typically steer clear of corporate chain restaurants whenever possible, but when mom sends us a gift card to Cheesecake Factory for Valentine&#39;s Day, all sense of discretion apparently goes out the window.  Seriously!  What kind of person in their right mind would choose to go here on a Saturday night?  Well that, my friend, would be us - and about 5,000 other insane and hungry people.  <br><br>When you set foot inside this Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s a wonder that this place could ever actually be filled to capacity.  It&#39;s enormous... with 2 levels of dining space, 2 bars, and (I believe anyway) 2 separate kitchens.  But no - when we arrived shortly after 7pm we were told that it would be 1.5 hours before we would be seated.  They didn&#39;t even have any more pagers left it was so busy!  Don&#39;t people know that there are a bunch of other great restaurants on the Plaza?<br><br>Instead of waiting, we decided to wander upstairs to the bar area to see if we could snag an open high-top table (first-come, first-served).  Getting upstairs proved to be an adventure as we had to climb over hordes of people who were seated on both sides of the stairway waiting for their name to be called.  When we finally reached the top, we were in luck - there was a table just getting up from their meal, so we quickly grabbed it and took a seat.<br><br>Now for the actual dining experience.  Have I mentioned yet that I&#39;ve never been a fan of Cheesecake Factory?  They have one of the most overwhelming menus that I&#39;ve ever seen in my life.  I swear it&#39;s 20-something pages long, with every type of food imaginable represented.  Personally, I&#39;d prefer them to pick one or two types of cuisine, perfect those, and get rid of the rest.  But nobody asked me, so I had a decision to make.  Not really in the mood for anything in particular, I decided to order the Cajun Chicken Pasta.  My wife ordered some type of salad.  When the food arrived, I immediately thought to myself, &#34;Wow... this is why the obesity rate in America continues to rise.&#34;  My oversized plate was full of pasta, which was drenched in an oil (or butter)-based sauce and topped with 4 pieces of breaded chicken.  The taste was fabulous, but I couldn&#39;t even finish half of it, and I wasn&#39;t about to try because I knew I had to save room for the best part of the meal - the CHEESECAKE, which as always was delicious.<br><br>All-in-all, our visit really wasn&#39;t all that bad.  We didn&#39;t end up having to wait for a table, our service was very good, and the food exceeded my expectations.  I just wouldn&#39;t choose to come here on a regular basis and battle the crowds when there are all sorts of other great dining options available in the area.
Utter perfection! From the steak Diane to the always yummy mashed potatoes, you can&#39;t go wrong. And they will serve you cheesecake!
Not a fan. Generic American food. Too many things on the menu that I feel they don&#39;t specialize in anything. I never eat here.

Food was okay. Place was clean. 2 Stars for service. Waitress decided to let our drinks stay empty for 5m at a time while she was fussing over another table. Under staffing imo. Giving too many tables. Will probably not return.

Came here for dinner before my appointment at Apple Store. We sat at the bar and was greeted by the bartender. I could not understand a single thing he said to us. It&#39;s not a language barrier that we encountered, it was his mouth full of marbles that prevented us from understanding him. With that being said, every time he talked to us, we just agreed out of sheer embarrassment or just stupidity. Lol. Other than that the food was awesome and picked up the S&#39;mores cheesecake, which is AAAMMMAAAZZINNNGG!  It must be Gods food!

Hello, thank you for taking the time to read this review. I was extremely disappointed and disgusted about my visit tonight. While visiting the Kansas City Missouri Country Club Plaza location, myself and my family waited for our table, while waiting there were two employees cleaning out the refrigerated case that the cheesecakes are displayed in while doing so she was trying to kill a fly cleaning the bottom of the cabinet out with a white rag wrapped around a spatula that she touched the side of a whole cheesecake with and then put it back in the cabinet and was going to leave it to sell it. This is not only completely unsanitary it&#39;s disgusting and gross as a customer to be standing there witnessing this along with other employees and nobody did anything. I spoke with the manager, Brock I believe was his name, he had a very nonchalant response to me, and to me seemed put out that I brought this to his attention. His only response to me was which cake was it? No apology, no comment that what had happened was completely unacceptable... nothing, at all. He walked back behind the counter and leaned in to speak to the two employees that had been cleaning the cooler and had one of the ladies remove the cheesecake I pointed out had been touched with the dirty cleaning rag. I will post the on Yelp also this evening to make sure the public is aware of how your manager handles things. I would have wanted someone to speak up if they had also witnessed this and that&#39;s the only reason I brought it to the manager&#39;s attention tonight. I will not return to this location and regret that I even stayed for dinner tonight. My family was there to celebrate my daughter&#39;s birthday and that is the ONLY reason we did not leave immediately after I witnessed this. Needless to say, no one in my party ordered dessert. Very disappointing Cheescake Factory...  on a very special occasion. Please use this as a learning experience. This used to be one of our very favorite places for birthdays... please do better.

Great place... Extremely fattening, but great, hahaha! This is a once a month or every other month affair, because once you leave here, in between the bread basket (plus butta), excellent entrees and cheesecake and coffee, you will need to let your pants out by the end of the evening. They do have a lighter menu... but let&#39;s be real... AIN&#39;T NOBODY GOT TIME FO DAT! IT&#39;S THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY MAN!!! So eat your fill and enjoy yourself. The food will not disappoint and the decor is beautiful! Every time I go I have a great waiter or waitress and enjoy my experience through and through! And chocolate lovers, it is your duty to try the Chris&#39;s Outrageous Cheesecake... CHOCOLATE OVERLOAD!!!! YEEEESSSSS!!!!

The service and food preparation are always consistently good at this location; we&#39;ve only had a few bad experiences, but they get the problem cleared up. My husband loves their kale and quinoa salad w/ salmon. I&#39;ve ordered their Shelia&#39;s cashew chicken salad, the Bistro Shrimp pasta, and the Antioxidant salad, and they are very good. Can&#39;t say a bad thing about any of their deserts. The Rocky Road Sundae, Apple Dumpling, and cheesecakes are my favorites. This location is definitely superior to the Overland Park location, so we don&#39;t go there anymore, even though it is closer to our house.

The food was good and decently priced.<br>The wait was non-existent.<br>Our waiter was professional but needed to be a little louder than the environment.<br>The cheesecake pieces are huge but exactly as described.<br><br>The downside?  The manager wearing grey on this date needs to learn to not hover over tables and be less loud communicating using his earpiece.

This place is going to overwhelm you with food. It&#39;s going to be pretty good, more than you wanted, better than you expected, and somehow still wanting some cheesecake afterward. God bless the heroes who can eat all their eyes desire at this place.

I am not used to waiting an hour and a half to eat, and normally would not do it if it was not for a family outing. It was a week night and the place was packed, elbow to elbow standing around waiting. After being seating the service was good, Our waiter was very attentive and did a good job taking care of 5 adults and 2 teenagers. Everyone was pleased with their dinner. My major problem was value. $16.95 for a bowl of pasta is a bit on the expensive scale for me. If you want to go eat out at a nice restaurant and don&#39;t mind waiting and paying inflated prices then you will enjoy it here.

It&#39;s not too often I write a negative post. And to write one for a Cheesecake Factory is almost absurd, But I have to! Minus the server poor guy .. Today I was served cold bread to start and then for breakfast I got served MOLDY bread and a cold breakfast. Bacon and eggs were cold!  manager came out with fresh hard bread and said he really does apologize and to let him know if there is anything else he can do .. And also promised  this had never happened before. Really?come on.

First off, the food was great. I wish I could say the same for the service, but I can&#39;t. Our waiter was too &#34;preoccupied&#34; staring at the woman next to us. Im guessing that she was his friend, but I thought it was supposed to be customers first? Anyway, while he kept talking to her, we saw our cheese cakes sitting on the counter ready to be served, and which they sat there a little too long. To round it all up, in the end while he was still preoccupied, he messed up our bills and gave us the wrong change. I think all of this could&#39;ve been avoided if our waiter would of just done his job right, and saved the friend visiting for after work.

We have always had good food and good service here , that said,sometimes you feel somewhat close to other tables and it is a little on the noisy side. The menu is comprehensive and if you can&#39;t find a cheesecake you like out of THAT selection there is no hope for you!
This place is a wreck. I waited an hour to be seated and the food was warm, not even hot and the prices are sky high. Last time I ever go there.

Will was our server and he was great! Great sense of humor and very kind. Southwest chicken sandwich was very flavorful and right amount of spice. They make their Bloody Mary mix in house and it is fabulous! Totally recommend.
The tables were dirty.  We were too close to other couples.  Poor service.  The food was good, great location, and a beautiful building with a short wait.

We came here for a co-worker&#39;s birthday and told them that we needed to be timely with our return to the office. The server was good about being conscientious about the timing. Good job!<br><br>Since the last time I have been here (who knows how many years??) they have added more items that are smaller sized or lower in calories. That&#39;s good but the sheer number of items on the menu is overwhelming.<br><br>Typical, I chose poorly. I saw a chopped salad that was smaller and lower in calories and it had blue cheese. Sold. It was very flavor-less. Boo. The other people all seemed to really enjoy their choices. No cheesecake was consumed on this visit.<br><br>Overall, our service was good and, for the most part, our group enjoyed their food. I would say this is a decent place to visit if you have a diverse group that cannot decide on one option. Just don&#39;t order the boring little chopped salad.

I am still baffled about what happened to me last night at Cheesecake Factory. I was dining by myself (very close to my hotel) and waited about 10 minutes when my buzzer went off. I saw the hostess grab a stack of menus and lead me to a table set up for 6 people. I informed her it was just myself, and she looked at me like I was crazy and asked if I was sure I didn&#39;t have a party of 6. Yep, pretty sure it&#39;s just me...<br>Ended up there was a mix up at the hostess stand; they paged the wrong buzzer. Then the three ladies at the hostess stand basically started arguing in front of me and other guests about their mix up. <br>I ended up getting taken to a different table and sat down. Shortly after the server came by, but offered no greeting. The first words out of his mouth were &#34;you need to give me a few minutes to get caught up&#34;. WOW! There are more tactful ways to address a waiting guest, such as &#34;hi, how are you? I&#39;ll be with you shortly&#34;. I was just taken aback by this and sat at my table about two minutes before getting up and leaving. There was no chance I was going to get good service even when he did &#34;catch up&#34;. Had a very nice meal across the street at PF Changs instead.

Depending on when you show up here, it could either be a nightmare to get in or a breeze.  When they first opened...back in the roaring 90s...this was a frequent gathering spot after work.  And it was ALWAYS packed.<br><br>My last visit was this weekend and we were seated right away by an overly friendly host.  Having not been here in a while, I was surprised at how empty the place was on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.  But I&#39;m not gonna complain about getting seated quickly.<br><br>The menu, as always, was a novel.  I had a hard time narrowing down my choices.  They have a new &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu with low-cal options that looked delicious.  Especially the Lettuce Mushroom Wraps.  I was tempted to try the veggie burger, but opted for the comfort of the Four Cheese Pasta.  I was happy that they offered most of their dishes in lunch portions, knowing the gargantuan size of their normal dinner dishes.  <br><br>The pasta was right on the money.  Tender penne pasta with a creamy tomato sauce.  Just what my belly was looking for.  <br><br>Service was friendly and attentive without being overbearing.  All in all it was an extremely nice lunch on the Plaza.  And it reminded me how much I really like this place.<br><br>My visit reminded me how much I love their brunches on Sunday, so I&#39;m definitely going to remember to come here.  The Lemon-Ricotta Pancakes look divine!

Yes, it&#39;s a chain, but I&#39;m not ashamed to admit that I love Cheesecake Factory.  It never disappoints!  The portions are huge and it&#39;s reasonably priced.  This location in particular has a great outdoor dining area.  Cheesecake Factory also offers a great cocktail menu....martinis, mojitos, etc.<br><br>My favorite things to eat at Cheesecake Factory:<br>The Whole Grain Bread!!<br>Luau Salad<br>Thai Lettuce Wraps<br>Crispy Chicken Costoletta<br>Brownie Sundae Cheesecake (which I usually take home since I never have room)

The food was great. My only complaint was how long it took to get our lunch. It took 30 minutes for us to get the food we ordered. This was on a Monday afternoon when it wasn&#39;t that busy. I suggest you take their offer when they ask you if you want bread. That way you won&#39;t starve before your meal gets to the table.

We had a wonderful experience here! There was a large party of us coming for dessert and drinks after my friend&#39;s wedding. Kyle, our server was amazing! He gave beautiful service and the cheesecake was to die for! Thank you Kyle with your awesome beard for making our night extra special with great service!  He was on top of drinks and added in the perfect amount of humor to the night! Ask for Kyle! He&#39;s da shiiiiiiit!

We went to Kansas City tonight for something different to do and go to one of our favorite places to eat. Well we got seated pretty quick which was great but it took a little long to get our supper but I understand it was busy. But my daughter ordered the salmon dinner and we had to send it back because it was raw and it took another 30 minutes to get it back in which my daughter lost interest in it. So that was disappointing. None the less the waitress kept telling us it was just a few minutes away well that was not true. All I suggest is that the manager should of come over to apologize for the inconvenience and what was disturbing was the still charged me for it. You know it&#39;s not our fault the cook didn&#39;t do his job properly. It&#39;s amazing how we expect so many things to be perfect and we get disappointed when it doesn&#39;t go over well. I hope I get some feedback so I can feel like I can go back someday. Thank you for your quick response  but not to be greedy is there a way to complete my satisfaction with a gift card or something to get me and my family back as loyal customers.

I must say it was truly amazing! Of course The Cheesecake Factory is known for its deserts, but unfortunately we didn&#39;t get a desert. We still let ourselves go with a delicious appetizer as well as a Stake Diane and a Hibachi Steak! Despite the waiting time it was still worth it in the end! 5/5 would do again

Sure it&#39;s a chain, but sometimes you just want some comfort food, and to know what you&#39;re going to get.  Food was decent, service was good. Sitting next to the goalkeeper of the 2013 MLS Champions, Sporting KC, was pretty cool, too!  I don&#39;t go here much, but I&#39;ve spotted some sports &#39;stars&#39; here on more than one occasion.

Cheesecake Factory<br> <br>I have gone to the Cheesecake Factory in the past and I have always had mixed feelings about the food. I often get the orange chicken lunch size, but once I got it dinner style. Well, I was astonished. They were both about the same size, yet you should be getting more for the dinner size. Second, I wish there had been less chicken and rice and more veggies. There were some veggies, but not as much as was needed to call it a side. The chicken was very high in calories and the chicken had too much batter on it. I was literally taking huge bites of batter when it should have been chicken. The Cheesecake Factory advertises it as Orange chicken, but when I was eating the chicken I could not taste the citrusy taste that comes with oranges. Their cheesecakes though are delicious and creamy. . The Cheesecake Factory has been criticized in the past by many people and even in books about the portion sizes and the portions are indeed huge.  But, that shouldn&#39;t surprise anyone!

This is our &#34;go to&#34; dessert place on the Plaza and it has never disappointed. I can&#39;t imagine a cheesecake that isn&#39;t delicious. The fresh whipped cream on the side just adds bonus points. The coffee is good, not great, but that is ok since the dessert is soooo good. My review is strictly based on Cheesecake and I promise, it is all good!

Food is delicious. Service was prompt and very acoomodating. The lunch portion is very generous and I can only imagine how big the dinner portions are.... and of course there are plenty of cheesecakes to choose from. If you&#39;re a coffee lover. . I recommend the tiramisu. We had the Banana cream and oreo cheesecake tonight and it was exquisite. I think the crowds are usually a little slow on Sundays between 2-5 ( which I believe are the best times to visit if you want to avoid the standard 30-40 minute waits for a table). Will return.
Went on Friday of last week again and enjoyed the service and the quality of food is just that quality!

Our server was AWESOME! One of the nicest servers I&#39;ve had in a long time. She was knowledgeable, brought our food as soon as it was done, apologized for the delay with our food, and was really great. The food, as usual was good. i had the Thai glazed salmon dish; love, love, LOVE the sauce for that dish!

I&#39;ve been here with family and friends and have yet to be disappointing. The other night, my friends and I went there for late night cheesecake, and even though it was getting late, the waiters were as friendly and accommodating as ever. The cheesecake was sublime and he even rounded down our checks! The reason for the 4 stars and not 5? The price. Delicious food, decadent cheesecake, but a little pricey. But great in every other aspect!

This being our first visit here I&#39;m almost opposed to give it 5 stars because I try &amp; go at least twice before giving such an outstanding rating. We had such a good experience I could not resist!! <br><br>Our waiter was very nice &amp; warming as soon as we sat down.. we had our toddler with us and went from a booster to a high chair and he was more than willing to help us get comfortable.  We started off with some cocktails, apple juice &amp; cherry coke.  Nothing fancy.  Then came our appetizer which was ordered the spicy chicken nachos.  Fresh guac, sour cream, pica de gallo  atop the enormous tray of cheesy nachos.  They were really good and almost filled us up.  Not to mention they serve you warm french &amp; this oat bran bread at the beginning with your drinks.  Then came our appetizers... I went with the spicy Louisiana chicken pasta &amp; my husband ordered the chicken &amp; biscuits.  OH MY GOSH!  No words can describe my pasta, the sauce absolutely perfect &amp; spicy, creamy!  Went perfect with the honey glazed chicken, peas, asparagus, and penne pasta.  Best pasta I&#39;ve ever eaten!!!  My husbands dish was equally simple yet divine in taste!  The sauce they used on the chicken and biscuits was to die for!  Our toddler LOVED both.  He absolutely loves spicy so he favored my dish! :)  <br><br>We couldn&#39;t resist to try the mouth watering cheesecake that we had seen in a display case when awaiting our table.  There&#39;s so many to choose from &amp; it&#39;s hard to decipher which you want.  So we went with the white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake (at the table for dessert to share)................................ need I say more?  The name explains it all and it was drizzled in caramel sauce with homemade whip topping!  Best cheesecake ever!  We ordered the carrot cheesecake to GO--- nothing short of amazing &amp; indulging as well.  <br><br>Our first trip here was great!  We many laughs, our serves were fabulous, the food was even better, drinks were the right price for consistency of the drink.  We left VERY happy &amp; very full.  Our toddler didn&#39;t even make it out of the parking garage without falling asleep.  Great evening.  I must say the decor of the place is outstanding as well.  <br><br>We will be returning very shortly &amp; recommending to all of our friends and family! <br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory for an extradoniary evening!

Who hasn&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory by now? Until this afternoon it was ME, that&#39;s who!<br><br>I know it&#39;s been there for what seems like forever but I&#39;ve never been. I went this afternoon with the intention of coffee and conversation. I ended up ordering two small plates (which I couldn&#39;t finish), cheese cake, AND coffee. Honestly, when you compare my order to the vastness of the menu, it&#39;s measly. I didn&#39;t even read through it all it was so large! I did make a note that they offered lunch until 5pm. Who does that?! <br><br>Some of the items are pricey, but the small plates were tempting and on the cheap. I got a Greek Salad. It wasn&#39;t very Greek in my opinion. There was so much chopped cucumber and tomatoes I didn&#39;t even notice the arugula. It was positively swimming in vinaigrette too. I don&#39;t like an over-dressed salad. The worst error of all was that it had goat cheese instead of feta. I adore feta. I detest goat cheese. <br><br>I also ordered the Vietnamese Tacos. The order came with 3 and I had to pawn one off on my friend because the steamed bun was so filling I could not eat all 3 and also eat cheesecake. They were absolutely delicious!! I would order them again in a heartbeat. <br><br>Finally the cheesecake: I ordered the Godiva chocolate which was a chocolate lovers dream. I ate half of it, which is a normal portion, I&#39;m sure. The coffee was just as my friend expected. It was a little too strong with a bitter aftertaste. Loads of cream and two Splenda&#39;s made it drinkable to me. I had one and a half cups. <br><br>Our waiter was friendly and appeared at just the right moments. The bathroom was clean, but lacked hooks to hang your purse in at least one stall. Boo to that!<br><br>I have no idea if I will ever find myself back at The Cheesecake Factory, as my Hubby doesn&#39;t like cheesecake and for the price we would choose a different place. If invited by friends, I would happily return however poor the coffee.
Stopped in for a drink and was blown away by the hospitality. Everyone was friendly and had a smile on their face and that&#39;s all I&#39;ve ever wanted from a restaurant.

I had never been to the Cheesecake Factory although it has been here for quite some time.  I am not one to dismiss &#34;chain&#34; restaurants just because they are a chain. I have had some pretty decent dinners or breakfasts in &#34;chain restaurants.<br>My husband and I went last Saturday around 3:00 p.m. We hadn&#39;t eaten all day and wanted something filling.  The wait was only 10 minutes.  We ordered the Tex-Mex Egg Rolls appetizer which came with 2 dipping sauces.  One salsa and one avacado.  There was barely a tablespoon of the avacado dip but the salsa dip was plentiful.  The avacado dip was delicious but not nearly enough for even one..forget about 2 people.<br><br>I ordered Salisbury steak with green beans and mashed potatoes.  My husband ordered the Chicken Enchiladas with rice and black beans.
